author: {'steamid': '76561199084240848', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 40, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1711249680}
review:
While there are several hidden object offerings (Good Job!), some items are not named correctly and others so obscurely drawn as to not be visible. Most of the other mini-games give insufficient instruction, even for those of us who have played many Artifex Mundi games. I'm not by any means an expert at the normal AM mini-games but finished the comprehensible ones very quickly. Not sure why. 
The timing of journal entries, while understandable in marketing for the widest range of potential players,  makes one want to throw something! I need no explanation of what I just completed! Please correct the spelling in the English version.  The map could be more interactive.  The bonus game is a plus since the original game goes quickly.  I see promise in this game; with a little continuity and content tweaking, it could be a great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007627220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1680528756}
review:
[h1]Охотница на демонов выходит на охоту.[/h1]

На одном отдалённом острове, в старом особняке, проживал профессор Эшмор. Однажды, прогуливаясь по окрестностям острова, он обнаружил девочку с красными глазами, которую звали Дона. Профессор помог девочке, выходил её, и вот много лет спустя, уже Эшмору понадобилась помощь девушки. Дона получает письмо с просьбой прибыть на остров и там узнаёт, что Эшмор погиб во время секретного эксперимента, а его помощник-студент настойчиво, ОЧЕНЬ настойчиво просит помочь проникнуть в подвал, где этот эксперимент проходил. Нам предстоит изучить особняк и окрестности, выяснить подробности эксперимента и разобраться с его последствиями. Вообще, сюжет здесь очень простой, чем всё закончится понятно по первым минутам игры. Да и персонажи по-настоящему дурацкие.

Ничего нового игра не предлагает. Мы, как обычно собираем предметы, применяем куда надо, да решаем задачки. Задачки попадаются заумные, с которыми надо повозиться. Поиски предметов достаточно интересные. Очень раздражает отсутствие логики, даже игровой. Сварганить сложную конструкцию, которая нажмёт на кнопку, хотя до кнопки можно легко дотянуться, как вам? А вот такой пример: есть подвал, заполненный ядовитым газом. Мы чиним вентиляцию, чтобы убрать газ, разгребаем завал, находим тайник со смертельной ловушкой, аккуратно деактивируем её, отрываем тайник и находим… выключатель, чтобы свет включить на втором этаже! Или моё любимое. В особняке есть лоджия, на которой стоит что-то вроде тотема или алтаря и в нём есть три отверстия для кристаллов. Мы лазаем по всему особняку, находим эти кристаллы, вставляем их в пазы и алтарь начинает красиво разворачиваться. Открывается центральная выемка, которая вся светится таинственным светом, а внутри маленький кругленький, мать его, камешек. Остальное там такое же печальное. Ещё здесь есть коллекционные предметы, которые очень хорошо спрятаны, но радует, что есть индикатор, показывающий, есть ли предмет на экране.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2957409474

А вот картинка, хоть и темновата, но хорошо проработана. Парк, маяк, каждая комната особняка проработана тщательно и с массой деталей. Смотреть приятно. Музыка тоже неплохая.

Как это часто бывает с первой игрой серии – она весьма посредственная. Кому-то может понравиться, лично мне нет. Посмотрим, что там будет дальше.

author: {'steamid': '76561199104122912', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1707501051}

author: {'steamid': '76561198307908110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1708045044}
review:
As much as I love Hidden Object games and games published by Artifex Mundi, this is a game that I am on the fence about.  While there are things this game has done well, there are other things that make this harder to complete and enjoy.  

This is the first in a series about a woman trying to figure out her identity and how it ties to these otherworldly entities.  The beginning of this story begins with her mentor disappearing and the protagonist looking for him.  We don't really know the ties this woman has to the mentor until much later in the story, so this game essentially is a prequel to us learning about who the protagonist really is.  In comparison to many of Artifex Mundi's other published games, this one really lacks in storyline, which makes it hard to understand what is happening and how it all ties together.  This game felt like an exploratory Hidden Object game, trying to figure out about the machine that supposedly killed the professor instead of focusing on the story of why this was happening and the correlation to the main character.  The small bit of story that we do end up getting is confusing to understand.  I am hoping that more of the questions that were raised in this game get answered in the next game because for right now, we don't know much about why this is all happening.  
I also thought the cut scenes were a little lack luster considering some of the other cut scenes I had seen from this publisher.  Most games at least show the character's mouths somewhat moving to the text and their movements were a little more fluid.  We didn't get much of that through the game.  The cut scenes at the end were very underwhelming and it felt as though they didn't have the attention to detail or consideration they should have for the plot.  I am willing to give some leeway here, especially since I know this is a game from a decade ago, but a little more could have been done to at least make the game a little more interesting to play.

The Hidden Object games themselves were interesting, though I do have my gripes with those too.  On a few occasions there were items that were misspelled or mis-named, the biggest one I can remember being a scorpion being named Scorpio.  I was expecting the horoscope, but thankfully it is depicted as a scorpion so it makes that one easier.  There are more that other people have noticed and outlined in the discussions.  There were also a fair amount of items in the puzzles that I just didn't know, the Hidden Object puzzles in the caves and mines being the hardest for me.  I had to look up what many of the items were, and even then, it was hard to find them in the puzzle which left me frustrated.  I do enjoy the wide range of items that were used, some even being used more than once, but I wish it was a little easier to pick out items.  

The music in this game was a little more repetitive than others, but for the most part, I thought it fit the atmosphere enough that I wasn't bothered by it repeating.  I would appreciate just a little more variation in the score while playing the game, especially during the moments that should be hyped up, but this is fine.  

I do enjoy the variety of achievements that had been provided for the game, though I did have some struggles with getting some of the achievements, namely the ones that had a time limit or couldn't have mistakes made.  For the most part though, they were relatively easy to finish, especially after a second playthrough.

As excited as I was to play another game in the Artifex Mundi collection, I am disappointed in the game and frustrated by some of the puzzles and lack of direction.  I really hope that the next game in this series answers the questions left behind by this one and the quality of it increases.  While I don't recommend playing this game, I would recommend it for anyone looking for some backstory to the character.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072690534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1707694839}
review:
The game has some issues. Namely, it has a horrid English translation with lots of typos; also, multiple similar objects in a single scene where only one is correct (e.g. goblets), what generates a lot of misclicks. Story has huge plot holes and inconsistencies too - guess it's not really suspicious when a scientist's assistant teleports away in a cloud of black smoke, is it.
Still, the ratio of HO scenes to point-and-click tasks is pretty good. I had fun. Hope sequels improved the areas where this one had failed, going to find out soon as I've bought the whole bundle xD

author: {'steamid': '76561198164458835', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1705385848}
review:
Il gioco in sé non è malvagio. L'avventura appare un po' piatta, con pochissimi stimoli per andare avanti, ma con un po' di impegno e costanza si lascia giocare. La realizzazione appare un po' grezza, mal rifinita, ma essendo un gioco un po' datato non ci si fa molto caso.
Quello che invece non mi va giù è la traduzione italiana. Non è fatta male, è proprio sbagliata, con parole totalmente a caso. Questo vi creerà non pochi problemi nelle scene di oggetti nascosti. Starete ore ed ore a scervellarvi dove è il caricatore per poi scoprire che il gioco intendeva un mestolo. Resterete molto delusi quando scoprirete che il divisore è in realtà un compasso e il ditale una spilla. Immagino anche la delusione quando scoprirete che il misterioso liniaal (parola che ho poi scoperto essere olandese) è in realtà un righello.

author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1706879684}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand—the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed—the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025839453', 'num_games_owned': 733, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1700025320}
review:
I was extremely disappointed by this game. I think based on the description and trailer I thought it could be way more than it was.

The story was lackluster, all puzzles were extremely easy and there was really nothing to keep me interested or entertained at any moment. 

I fortunately bought this game as a very cheap bundle of the Demon Hunter games, so I'm not suffering from buyers remorse yet. 

I can't recommend this game at its current price. Maybe at a .99 cent sale if you just want to pass the time.

It was okay but I probably won’t play it again so I guess it’s good if you want to only entertain yourself for an hour or two

author: {'steamid': '76561198012377686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1699736905}
review:
Demon Hunter is a perfect example of what happens when a hidden object game with a deep story is just rushed to hell and back with no sense of quality.

The story is lacking and just overall bad, the hidden object gameplay is often faulty and will lead you to think you're clicking on the wrong item only to later discover that you had the right object but the game didn't register it as correct.
And the achievements for this game are CRUEL. The key puzzle achievements demand perfection, while the puzzles are absolutely atrocious. And should you make a mistake, then too bad. There's no room for mistakes in poor games, so if you mess up on one of the final puzzles with yet another unforgiving achievement, you'll just have to start over from the very beginning of the game and play all the way back and hope you don't make the tiniest error or that the game decides to not register it.

If you got this game in a bundle and would like to kill some time, go ahead and install it. But even if it's on sale, it's genuinely not worth the cost.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045411242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1697640328}
review:
[u]Recommendation[/u]: A standard Artifex Mundi hidden object game that is elevated by better than usual voice acting (with one notable exception).

[u]Critique[/u]: This has all the hallmarks of Artifex Mundi games: female protagonist, supernatural horror, at least one crow, a bunch of hidden object scenes, various adventure-game puzzles (including using a coin as a screwdriver), little mini games that space out the action, creepy deepfake CGI in cutscenes, and ridiculously vague names for items that you are trying to find (cloth, divider, and so on), to name several. What sets this one apart from the others is the 3D animation - there are several cut scenes where you use tools, and the tools are lovingly animated in full 3D - and the English voice acting. 

The voice acting is, on the whole, much better than in previous games. The actors are emoting, speaking in dialect (or at least accents), and sounding like real people...with one notable exception. The protagonist has one line just at the beginning of the game that is so hilariously wooden that my kids and I have got a lot of humor out of jokingly quoting it. Thankfully, this game doesn't have the protagonist talk more than once...or, if there were originally more lines, they were cut in post-production. The other thing I'll say about the voice acting is that there is one character - the professor's assistant? the doctor? - whose voice actor was tremendously miscast. You have a clean-cut, somewhat effete young man in a lab coat, and he speaks with a voice of a 60-year-old hermit who has spent the last 20 years screaming at the clouds. It's a weird juxtaposition, and (as I was trying to get all the achievements) the cognitive dissonance shocked me anew every time he spoke in the three times I played through the game.

Delightfully, this game does NOT have alternative game modes, so you don't have to play through it multiple times to earn all the Steam achievements. Why then did I play through the game multiple times? It's because of the labyrinth. The labyrinth is a fun new addition to the mini-games: you have to trace a continuous path through a maze from start to finish without stopping, without touching the walls of the maze, and within a short time limit (something like 40 seconds). Any time an Artifex Mundi game introduces a new and different mini-game, I get excited! But this implementation of the labyrinth confused both my daughter and I, to the point that we failed to earn the achievement on the first playthrough...and then failed again on the second playthrough. It's not that the maze is hard. As you trace your path through the maze, the mouse cursor leaves a little green trail marking where you've been. The problem is that, at seemingly random places in the maze, a loud BUZZ! will sound an a red dot appear as you are tracing your path. Instinctively, we all felt that this meant that we had touched the side of the maze (I cannot stress enough how much this buzzer and red dot reminded me of the classic game "Operation!") and lost the game. So we would restart, get the buzz, restart, buzz, and soon enough the time ran out. You can complete the maze even after the timer runs out, but you don't get the achievement. My daughter completed the game easily, but I came back and played it again to try to solve the labyrinth in a way that I wouldn't get any buzzing or red-dot mistakes. No luck; I got buzzed and failed, too. What was going on? It took us quite some time to figure out what we were doing wrong. We were so stumped that we read through guides after the second failure trying to learn what we were doing wrong. I must point out that the guides were NO HELP AT ALL. They just said "Do the maze before the time runs out," without mentioning the failure state of touching the sides and getting the buzzer/red dot. What we eventually realized is that [i]the buzzing and red dots have NOTHING to do with how you are doing in the maze[/i]. The buzz and red dots occur at the same places in the maze each time. As best as I can guess, they're just there to fluster you and have no actual effect on your success/failure of the mini-game.

One note about the hidden object scenes: these were on the more difficult end of the spectrum, for Artifex Mundi games. The scenes were all very visually busy, with lots and lots of objects that you aren't trying to find; many of them had a very muted, sepia tone that masked the colors that you would expect to see in a given object; some of the objects in each scene were "morphing objects" that periodically change from the object you're trying to find to another, unrelated object (and you can only "find" the object when it's in the correct state); there were often more than one of a given object, but you have to click on just the specific one that the game wants (I'm looking at you, "bottle"); a lot of the object names are so general that you can't really have an image of what you're trying to find in your head (such as "cloth"); and there are a couple of instances where the name of the object is completely WRONG (a compass or protractor is called "a divider," for example). With the exception of the wrong words being used (which is obviously very frustrating, because you're looking for the wrong thing), I found these added challenges fun.

[u]Review[/u]: [spoiler]You go to an estate to investigate the disappearance of the scientist who raised you and the strange phenomena that have been occurring in the area since then. You arrive by car and a mysterious cloaked figure who appears and disappears in a cloud of black smoke sets fire to your car. You meet a kindly old woman, a neighbor of the scientist, who enlists your aid in retrieving her cat. You meet an old sailor who is working as a lighthouse keeper and help him restore the lamp on the lighthouse, which then burns away a ghostly mist preventing your entry into the house. Getting into the house, you are greeted by the scientist's young assistant, who urges you to meet him in the attic with a voice of a haggard old wizard...and then disappears in a cloud of black smoke. You solve a number of puzzles to get access to the attic, and then restore power to the scientist's lab...where you discover that the assistant is actually a puppet of a extradimensional demon that the scientist had summoned. The demon had destroyed the scientist, and then has been steering the assistant. The assistant has been using you to help in freeing the demon from the machine the scientist used in the summoning. Using a storm board, you summon a thunderstorm and catch the assistant in a trap in which a bolt of lightning vaporizes him. The demon watches helplessly as you enter the basement, repair an old diving suit, power up the equipment, and venture under the sea to pit a giant shark against a kraken and rebuild the infrastructure that was damaged by the demon's initial attack/appearance, and you collect all the stones to close the portal and seal the demon away from the world of the living.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198061743101', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1694970495}
review: The game started off great but as you progress the HOG scenes have items that appear multiple times making it far more likely you'll miss click as it's impossible to tell the difference for what they actually want. Some puzzle mechanics are very clunky and having achievements tied to completing something on your first try or else replay the entire game is not something I can recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198253750103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 724, 'last_played': 1688795343}
review:
Poorly implemented achievements and some problems with terminology in the HOGs made this a frustrating game to finish.

The problems I have with the HOGs may be a result of localization issues, but there were several times where it was not clear what I was meant to be searching for. As an example, one scene has you potentially looking for a "directional quadrant". What they mean is a sextant. But because they don't use the correct term you're stuck clicking all over the screen to find the object.

For the achievements - I do not like achievements that require you to get a puzzle correct on the first go round. As you cannot save the gae prior to trying to solve the puzzle. Also some puzzles are incredibly easy to disqualify the related achievement (Alchemy puzzle my belothed

author: {'steamid': '76561198838993489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1682894587}
review:
Pra esse jogo ser ruim ele ainda tem que MELHORAR MUITO. (contém spoilers daqui pra frente)
Você chega na mansão do seu falecido mentor e quem está lá é o assistente dele, que misteriosamente desaparece em uma nuvem de fumaça maligna. QUEM SERÁ O VILÃO, NÃO É MESMO???
A primeira cena eu já tinha desvendado toda a trama, tirou toda a vontade de jogar, e ainda assim eu continuei. Os cenários são bonitos, mas isso é tudo que tem de bom, porque de resto é mal feito, sem sal, sem graça, sem cor e sem sabor. Não recomendo e fico feliz de ter me custado só dois reais.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020225761', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1670494613}
review:
Very average at best. Visuals, while sometimes inconsistent, are rather good. Story is kinda meh. It is the first game in the serie, thus it seems like developers at that moment didn't have a clear vision what will it be, because here you have something from everywhere: scientists, ghosts, demons, stuff from different mythologies, etc. 

Besides, for the most part of the game, you are doing stuff totally unrelated to the main story. Go here, do that, bring this, save the cat, help the lighthouse keeper, etc. Mystery story, yeah. Most of the info you get from letters (bad decision) and right at the end. HOG scenes and puzzles were more or less ok, but too easy. 

Honestly, initially I hesitated to give this game a thumb down, but bonus chapter totally ruined this shaky balance. It's s-so lazy that there is no doubt that it was done just for a checkmark. Nothing new, mini games are total copy-cats from the main game and they even copy each other withing this pigmy bonus chapter. "Puzzle" with liquids - looking at you specifically. In the end, as a standalone game, it gets "no" from me. But there are few other good games in this serie, so you may want to get it for the story/collection. Thus - get it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198380886068', 'num_games_owned': 796, 'num_reviews': 201, 'playtime_forever': 491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1680623681}

author: {'steamid': '76561197968073802', 'num_games_owned': 381, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1680110203}
review:
Good, detailed game, with a decent story. Some written English could have been better. The music in the game can sometimes be pretty nice; while other times it's just accords played on the piano. Simple, but it works, I'll guess.

The only thing I didn't like was how little it could take, to have to replay the game if you like doing achievements. For example I was at the end of playthrough nr. 2, trying to finish the very last achievement, but I accidently clicked the exit arrow, and so I had to do the game over again a third time.

Otherwise a game I would recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561199158947454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1680491841}
review:
I absolutely try and avoid giving bad reviews since I try and see the positives more, but out of all these hidden object games I've played so far, I gotta say this is the one I couldn't bring myself to enjoy. First of all the achievements are really really annoying to get and I will have to go back into the game to try and get them, with that, for this particular game and it's achievements it would've been better to have a self-save mechanic so it would have been possible to try the mini games and such again and again without having to play the whole game all over again. 
The story could've been better. I liked the pretty skies in this game but they didn't really match with the overall art of the game, it just seemed a bit all over the place.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972610203', 'num_games_owned': 5647, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1677252141}
review:
I love Artifex Mundi hidden object adventure games. This was the start of another series that I had yet to play.
The general plot is about trying to get into this house and investigate a demon haunting, and eventually banish it. The main character I'm assuming is the same through all the sequels, because it seemed to imply she came into her birthright by the end of the game, and will possibly have some sort of power in the sequels.

This was a pretty standard hidden object game. It didn't dive too deep into fantastical realms, just locations around this small island and the inside of a mansion. I like them better when they are more fantastical, which I'm thinking the sequels will be. There was a bonus chapter that, while it didn't add much to the plot, did tick that fantastical button for me, but it was just a 'dream'.

It says 7 hours of playtime, but I know I had it on while I was playing D&D yesterday so it was probably closer to 5.

My only gripe is there was some glaring spelling errors. (see screenshot I posted)

author: {'steamid': '76561199100615563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1675961094}
review:
This is a fun game if you are a fan of puzzles, hidden objects, brain teasers etc. BUT there is a major issue for Achievement lovers who want to 100% the game that can result in anger and frustration.
If you are attempting to go for the Alchemist Achievement, (make gold in 70 seconds) you need to prep yourself because if you screw up once you have to play THE ENTIRE GAME ALL OVER AGAIN since it automatically saves after every object gathered.
This is incredibly frustrating since you need to be exact with your clicks and avoid backing out of the puzzle screen to the room since the exit area is too close to the bowl you need to pour the chemicals. even for Speed runners who are experts the game play you need to do in order to get back to the alchemy puzzle is almost 2 hours of work.
If you are not an achievement hunter and don't mind missing the pressure of getting everything or timed challenges. This game is fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198284311383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1674901620}

author: {'steamid': '76561198956299818', 'num_games_owned': 2010, 'num_reviews': 727, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1674696455}

author: {'steamid': '76561198108477898', 'num_games_owned': 341, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1674162640}
review:
I've played a dozen of hidden object / puzzle games, but this particular one gave me a shudder. And no, I don't expect that type of games to deliver wonderful storyline, mechanics or uber graphics / visual effects . My expectations are rather minimal, if it comes to puzzle games or point and click.

  This game, however, managed to make me feel utterly  disappointed . It was boring and almost nothing had any particular sense [spoiler]( yes , because normally people keep cheese in a box and you need to find a key to unlock it.. so precious, MY PRECIOUS ..CHEESEEE! possibly stinky ,but ok.)[/spoiler] . 
Characters were dull and I just hoped it would end quickly... Puzzles or Hidden Object scenes are just a copy paste from other AM games, visuals are poor and same goes with special effects. Some HO scenes you will replay two times and it gets even more humdrum. Nothing exciting or spicy. Meh'ish . 
[b]I can advise anyone ,who is reading this to purchase this game during a sale , it's not worth its full price.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198098271490', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1672672878}
review:
I suppose this is bit older ArtifexMundi. It does show up in the graphics here and there but it's not the most horrible looking. 

Plot is quite ok. Voice acting is bit of eh. There aren't huge character moments or grand suspence or breakthroughs. It was fun to play through though. Am quite happy for skip option on some of the puzzles because no way in hell my capasity works around math, it's all reserved to literature. Also take this from someone who speaks two languages and  who has studied three other languages and am not native with English. Some of the items and words were new and some items culturally bit different when thinking about what kind of a item they might be looking in the hidden object games.

So, yes, there are puzzles to solve and hidden objects.  And you can't really go wrong with neither. Apparently you can play them after you complete the game as separated from the story ascpect.

One thing about the gameplay however that I had missed had been an option to go back to the beginning to look for the missing items that you need to collect. Once you enter into the house. You can't go back to wander around that check if there are anything you missed. 

Though scientist guy who turns into smoke isn't suspicious at all.... It is. So ending wasn't much suprise. Another thing for the ending is that well I suppose ancient demon ready to materialize has all the time in the world to wait for you to solve out some puzzles to get items you'll need.

Overall not the best of Artifex Mundi but not the worst either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198304582482', 'num_games_owned': 46, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 733, 'last_played': 1670609514}
review:
Wow… Where do I start… I guess I’ve been spoiled.
For starters you can definitely tell this game is older. I’m not knocking it for that though, just know that this title lacks some of the intuitive gameplay that you would expect to see in newer releases in the hidden objects genre.
The solutions to some of the puzzles seem super obscure compared to other newer releases too.
While this game isn’t bad, there are simply better titles out there. I’d say check it out if you’re curious and it’s on sale.
Also… 1 achievement was an absolute pain to get. It’s the mixing near the end of the game and I swear I played the game like 4 times just to get it. IYKYK

author: {'steamid': '76561198085858209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1670097554}
review:
Oh boy...this is the worst HOG I've ever played. Granted, it had a nice premise and TONS of HOGs, but it was so poorly done.

Story: 1.5/5
The basic concept is good: A young woman with mysterious powers and no idea who or what she is goes to investigate a potentially paranormal incident involving the man who adopted her when she was a child. However, very little time is spent on this story. Most of the time you're sent around doing tasks and puzzles that add nothing to plot and drag the plot to a snail's pace. I mean, why do we have bees chilling in a corner of a house with a random piece of honeycomb? Why do we need to go under the ocean? Why do we need to find a lost cat? So many useless things that I kind of forgot what the story even was at some points.

The ending was terrible, too, with the dumbest villain ever: he has powers but doesn't to stop the protagonist at all. So you can run around and do everything without worrying about him. You beat him eventually without much effort and then...that's it.

The bonus chapter was awful. It was some sort of weird dream involving the protagonist's fears? Like the dentist and the jungle. Again, it adds nothing to the story save for the most basic of info about the protagonist.

Graphics: 3/5
The environments look relatively nice and detailed, especially the home (I like old, "antique" houses). Characters are awkwardly animated, sometimes with their mouths moving like puppets with little body movement. One guy was never moving his mouth while talking! Luckily, you don't interact with many characters.

Soundtrack: 3/5
There were some very fitting tracks that were eerie and suspenseful, but there were some that were very grating, like the cheesy "detective" music you hear at the very start of the game. There are also some annoying sound effects such as a "shing" noise when you do something wrong, "sparkles" when completing certain tasks, and "twinkling" sounds when playing HOGs.

Hidden Object Puzzles: 3.5/5
This game has a truck load of HOGs, and they were all well-made and even a little challenging at times when it came to finding certain items. However, there are a couple problems: Some words don't match well with the items you are looking for (i.e. "candlestick" for candelabra, "Gryphon" for "Griffin. Yes, "Gryphon" is another name for Griffins but I'm not sure many people will know this. I had to look it up.) The other issue is that the story is already a slow-paced, convoluted mess that adding in so many HOGs slowed the story down even further. It got to the point where I was sick of seeing HOGs because I just wanted the game to be done and over with ASAP.

Other Puzzles: 2.5/5
Many of them don't make much sense to the plot, and some are tedious and annoying to complete. Some of them, though, are still fun to do regardless of their impact (or lack thereof) on the story.

Voice Acting: 3/3
Decent for the most part but the villain sounded corny and cliche and the main character's voice was flat and emotionless. 

Overall Rating: 55%
I wouldn't recommend buying this one unless you are a die-hard HOG fan, a completionist, or the game is super cheap (like 99 cents). If you need a cure for insomnia, though, this game will help you out in that regard.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128438959', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1667162884}
review:
[h1] Do yourself a favor and don't waste your time with this game [/h1]

Can you do worse than Tiny Tales? Yes. Yes you can and this game is proof of that.

In this game I didn't know half the time why I was doing something I was doing and why I was going to a place I just went to.
The story makes no sense and the animations are.... Okay.
Characters don't have any personality, and hare-brained decisions are made along the way that were completely incomprehensible. For example, one of the few characters in the game tells you that demonic creatures have come through a portal and that we should help him open the portal again, because reasons. He then keeps disappearing and appearing in front of our eyes in a black smoke. We don't question it and then help him open the portal. And surprise! He is one of the bad guys! 

At least the hidden object games were alright and there was also a cute cat, but the negative sides are too heavy.
Playtime was about 3h.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025046585', 'num_games_owned': 977, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1666577103}

author: {'steamid': '76561197982504799', 'num_games_owned': 4252, 'num_reviews': 2873, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1665014214}
review:
Охотники на демонов: Хроники потустороннего мира — ищуха средней руки. С картами.

[h1] Сюжет [/h1]
Сидели ученые в мрачном особняке, и экспериментировали с [strike] зомби-вирусом [/strike] с разным оккультным, и вот таки доэкспериментировались до открытия портала во адЪ. И проснулся Думгай… хотя не, это в другой игре. В общем отправилась в особняк приёмная дочка профессора дабы узнать что за чѳртовщина там творится. И немножко отомстить за батю. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2871840885

Сюжет в целом норм для казуалки, но не более. Каких-то интересных перипетий истории тут можно не ждать.

[h1] Геймплей [/h1]
Ищуха как она есть. Ищем предметы, используем их, решаем пазлы, коих не так много, однако среди них есть и зачётные (алхимия вообще зло под конец), и ковыряем сцены поиска. Сцен поиска достаточно много, это радует. При этом они достаточно простые, что уже на вкус и цвет.

Минусы: может пролагивать достижение за 3 пройденных сцены поиска без подсказки и неверных кликов. Морфирующие предметы не всегда кликаются.

[h1] Графоний и музоний [/h1]
Кат-сцены неплохие, дизайн локаций яркий и приятный, разрабы постарались. Музыка норм. По визуалу все годно для жанра, имхо.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2871840925

[h1] Как итог  [/h1]
Средней руки ищуха, достаточно яркая и приятная по картинке, норм по геймплею, средне по сюжету. К тому же карты есть. Сыграть можно, но не шедевр.
6 демонов из 10

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1276831459

[i]P.s: если этот обзор был для Вас полезен ставьте лайк, а также добавляйтесь в друзья и подписывайтесь на меня как куратора - [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/28776273/] Обзоры онлайн [/url][/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561197987391854', 'num_games_owned': 2379, 'num_reviews': 611, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 542, 'last_played': 1662512585}
review:
Demon Hunter: Chronicles from Beyond é um conto emocionante ambientado na América dos anos 1930. O jogo conta a história de Dawn Harlock, uma mulher incomum de olhos vermelhos, que deve retornar à propriedade de sua família em Iowa Island para investigar a misteriosa morte de seu mentor, o professor Ashmore. Não demora muito para que Dawn descubra vestígios de experimentos horríveis e tenha que ficar cara a cara com um mal antigo de outro mundo.

Durante a investigação, nossa protagonista começa a suspeitar que alguém, ou algo, atravessou o nosso mundo de outra dimensão e que seu próprio passado misterioso desempenha um grande papel nesses eventos perturbadores.

Dawn terá que desenterrar os segredos escondidos dentro de uma mansão sombria, desvendar o mistério de um experimento grotesco e descobrir o que realmente aconteceu todos aqueles anos atrás, quando o professor Ashmore a encontrou vagando sem rumo pela ilha.

A verdadeira identidade de Dawn será a chave para derrotar o antigo mal de outra dimensão?

author: {'steamid': '76561197977536331', 'num_games_owned': 2816, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 1183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1183, 'last_played': 1661722418}
review:
STORIA: Non male anche se forse un pelino troppo abbozzata,
GAMEPLAY: Hidden object classico.
GRAFICA: Belle location ben disegnate con inserimento degli oggetti ben contestualizzato, in alcuni frangenti anche particolarmente ispirata.
SONORO: Niente di eccezionale la colonna sonora fa il suo dovere.
CONTROLLER: Consigliato mouse e tastiera.
DURATA: Circa 20 ore per il completamento di tutti gli achievement.
RUN COMPLETAMENTO: Una, ma attenzione che molti achievement sono missabili e quindi potreste dover ricominciare la storia almeno un altro paio di volte.
COMMENTO: Il gioco mi è piaciuto, la storia non è male, la grafica buona e il sonoro accettabile, forse un pelino breve. Il vero problema di questo gioco, ed è davvero inaccettabile per un Hidden Object, è il fatto che alcuni oggetti da cercare sono stati tradotti malissimo in italiano altri nemmeno tradotti e sono rimasti in Tedesco (credo). Questo ti porta in alcuni casi a cercare l'oggetto a caso cliccando su tutto quello che uno vede a schermo invalidando così anche alcuni achievement.
VOTO: 60/100

author: {'steamid': '76561197971284198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1659929901}
review:
This is among the older Artifex Mundi hidden object puzzle adventure games, the first entry in a series, but among the better titles in their older game collection.

Mechanics wise, I think it's a testament for Big Giant Studio games on how well balanced things are. Despite having a bunch of stuff that I don't personally like a lot, which again is a personal thing that might not be the case for others, the way the game balances things makes me not mind them much.

Stuff like having to find objects strewn around regular scenes and not hidden object parts, the resolution and dimensions of objects being very wonky at times (like objects being too big or too small in comparison to others in the scene, having weird perspectives, weird shifts in resolution, etc), a few hidden object parts out of a hoarder nightmare, and a few hidden objects that cheat a bit to make it harder for you to spot them - like being behind a bunch of crap, using a pretty weird design for the object it was supposed to represent, and trying to disguise it by matching colors with the scenario.

Other stuff are the objects that changes over to something else after a few seconds, collectibles that are also hard to find because it mixes with the background, and stuff among the lines.

In games that are unbalanced and focus too much on annoying things, stretches the game too much because of those, or that don't have enough variation throughout the game... I'd be inclined not to recommend. But at least from the games I've played so far, I think the one thing Big Giant Studio games get right (which this one is) is on striking a good overall balance between elements that makes the game enjoyable even if it has some stuff that might annoy you. xD

Of course, keep in mind that this title is plenty old, and the games coming from the studio evolved a ton over the years... the differences are pretty obvious if you play any of their newer titles, but it seems Big Giant always understood that there is a balance to be achieved with the mechanics, which is not always true for all studios that work with Artifex Mundi.

Story wise, it's not too dissimilar from other Artifex Mundi games... you are the adopted daughter of some sort of science genious, and after news of an accident who took your father's life away, you go back to his crazy mansion filled with stuff from sci-fi, folklore, magic and whatnot to investigate. In the midst of that, dangers arise, and you find more about your own story.
I mean, it's not anything super incredible (or perhaps it'd be more adequate to say it has so many fantastical things mixed up with it that it ends up being a bit weird), but works well with this type of game.

Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995207328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1657801674}
review:
Un jeu d'objets cachés très classique.

Il n'est pas très compliqué par rapport à la moyenne des dizaines de jeux du même type auxquels j'ai pû jouer.

Toutefois,  quelques objets cachés  sont indiqués en langues étrangères (anglais, allemand, italien). C'est un ou deux nom d'objet par tableau et c'est un clairement un bug mais ça m'a rajouté un peu de difficulté et ça ma bien fait rire !

Si vous êtes prêt à pardonner cette bévue aux développeurs et que vous ne voulez pas d'énigmes trop complexes, je vous le recommande.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132995625', 'num_games_owned': 1414, 'num_reviews': 754, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1657205601}
review:
[h1] Demon Hunter: Chronicles from Beyond [/h1]
Casual game of 2014.

Demon Hunter: The Supernatural Chronicles is a thrilling story set in 1930's America. The game tells the story of Dawn Harlock, an unusual red-eyed woman who must return to her family home on the island of Iowa to investigate the mysterious death of her mentor, Professor Ashmore. Not much time goes by before Dawn discovers traces of horrific experiments and must contend with an ancient evil from another world.

A mediocre detective point and click game. Pretty difficult Hidden Objects, which isn't bad. The mini-games aren't that difficult, which isn't a bad thing. There is help for finding the way, which is also not bad. So technically the game is well done with some interesting content.
What bothers me is the structure of the gameplay in connection with the abstruse story. But that's a matter of taste.
Definitely worth a look.

[h1] Demon Hunter: Chronicles from Beyond [/h1]
Gelegenheitsspiel von 2014.

Demon Hunter: Chroniken des Übernatürlichen ist eine spannende Geschichte aus den 1930er Jahren in Amerika. Das Spiel erzählt die Geschichte von Dawn Harlock, einer ungewöhnlichen rotäugigen Frau, die zu ihrem Familiensitz auf der Insel Iowa zurückkehren muss, um den mysteriösen Tod ihres Mentors Professor Ashmore zu untersuchen. Nicht viel Zeit vergeht, bevor Dawn Spuren von schrecklichen Experimenten entdeckt und es mit einem uralten Bösen aus einer anderen Welt aufnehmen muss.

Ein Mittelmäßiges Detektiv Point & Click Spiel. Ziemlich schwere Wimmelbilder, was ja nicht schlecht ist. Die Minispiele sind nicht so schwer, was ja auch nicht schlecht ist. Für die Wegsuche gibt es eine Hilfe, ebenfalls nicht schlecht. Also Technisch gesehen ist das Spiel gut gemacht mit einigen Interessanten Inhalten.
Was mich stört ist der Aufbau des Gameplay in Verbindung mit der abstrusen Geschichte. Aber das ist Geschmacksache.
Durchaus ein Blick Wert.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962767542', 'num_games_owned': 3169, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1651878884}
review:
Demon Hunter: Chronicles from Beyond est un jeu d'enquêtes, parsemés de mini-jeux et hidden objects. C'est la spécialité de l'éditeur "Artifex Mundi". J'apprécie ce côté reposant de ces jeux, on se prend pas trop la tête, un bouton "hint" nous aide lorsque l'on est réellement bloqué. Entre deux jeux bourrins, c'est bien de se détendre là-dessus et de faire un 100% sympa.

L'histoire de ce premier opus de Demon Hunter est assez basique, il va falloir pénétrer dans une demeure pour battre un démon maléfique, pour ça vous allez devoir explorer la grande bâtisse et ses environs. J'ai apprécié l'ambiance sonore, les dessins, et l'immersion proposée.

On regrettera par contre amèrement la traduction française perfectible, certains mots n'étant carrément pas traduit, d'autres assez mal, et quelques fautes d'orthographe repérées. 

Côté succès comptez entre 5 et 8 heures pour l'obtenir à 100%, il vous sera difficile de tous les obtenir lors de votre premier run, certains nécessite une connaissance du jeu plus accrue. Nul doute que lors de votre seconde run, vous serez beaucoup plus rapide à effectuer les énigmes et les différentes recherches d'objets. Le succès de l'alchimiste peut vous poser problème, il est loin d'être évident, je vous conseille donc de désactiver le steamcloud afin de pouvoir récupérer votre save, et ainsi sauvegarder quelques instants avant d'effectuer ce mini-jeu. En cas d'échec vous pourrez remettre la save précédent l'échec pour retenter votre chance sans refaire tout le jeu. Malheureusement ce mini-jeu de l'alchimiste se situe à la toute fin du jeu.

J'ai pour ma part avant de trouver cette technique (et de n'en avoir finalement pas besoin), dû refaire le jeu trois fois ! La dernière run étant un speedrun méritant largement un succès ^^ !

Pour conclure je dirais donc que "Demon Hunter: Chronicles from Beyond" est un bon jeu d'enigmes, type hidden objects, qui plaira à toute la famille. On est clairement dans ce que Artifex sait faire, on ne lui en demande pas plus !

Les + :
- Une jolie ambiance sonore
- Des dessins soignés
- De de la recherche d'objets intelligente
- Régulièrement soldé à très bas coût

Les - :
- Scénario assez simpliste
- Traduction française perfectible
- Quelques mini-jeux en-dessous des autres

Côté succès :
- Solo : Oui
- Multi : Non
- Broken ? Non
- Durée : 5-8H
- Difficulté : Normale

review:
Игра очень скучная, занудная до зубовного скрежета.
Сюжет здесь минимален, а все остальное время нескончаемая беготня по локациям взад-вперед и бесконечный поиск предметов и решение загадок.
К концу игры хочется проскипать уже все задания, добраться до финала и наконец стереть эту игру с диска и из памяти.
Мерзопакостная, скучная поделка, которую лучше вообще не запускать...

author: {'steamid': '76561198207083779', 'num_games_owned': 1292, 'num_reviews': 853, 'playtime_forever': 174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1649394264}
review:
MMMMMMMMM...  Didn't hate it.  It's actually pretty...  Alright!  You will play for around 3 hours...  Depending on how good you are at these games + there is a Bonus game (NO TELEPORT in bonus game).  Not a deal breaker.

I like the cinematics...  The sounds...  The hidden stuffs...  I didn't really see a problem with it, apart from maybe it being shorter than intended?  There are also achievements you can replay for.  The only problem I had was with the "blade puzzle".  I couldn't for the life of me get the top knife TO GO BACK IN!  I don't know how I did it...  Holy.

OH!  And that puzzle with "100 lbs" ->  "10 lbs" LOVE IT!  That's hilarious!

Well that's it.  That's all you need to know...  That and the bad guy is obvious.  *Cough* his last name + do you see how he leaves?  LOVE THE kitty...  The wild kitty...  The hedgie and...  Other cuties.  XD

Dododododo!  Thank you!  :) =) :3

author: {'steamid': '76561199039427864', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1648327410}
review:
It's a straightforward HOG, as many of the others that exist. Except, the plot was so plain and left to the side that it failed to build up a proper story alongside the game. The art-style and graphics are decent, the hidden objects and mini-games are also simple. 

Overall, I give this a 2/5 stars.

author: {'steamid': '76561199083925377', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1648228431}
review:
Demon Hunter: Chronicles from Beyond é um conto que ocorre na América dos anos 30. O jogo conta a história de Dawn Harlock, uma mulher de olhos vermelhos fora do comum que deve retornar ao patrimônio familiar na Ilha de Iowa para investigar a morte misteriosa de seu mentor, Professor Ashmore. Dawn não tardou a descobrir evidências de experiências aterradoras e tem de se deparar com um antigo mal de outro mundo. Nisso durante a investigação, a protagonista começa suspeitando que alguém, ou algo, fez a travessia para nosso mundo de outra dimensão e que seu passado misterioso tem um grande papel nestes eventos perturbadores. Então ela terá que desenterrar os segredos espreitando em uma mansão sombria, desvendando o mistério de uma experiência grotesca e descobrir o que realmente aconteceu há todos esses anos quando o Professor Ashmore a encontrou vagueando sem rumo na ilha.
A história tinha de tudo para ser perfeita, mas o enredo ficou fraco com muito poucos detalhes o que deixou bem tosca, apesar do jogo ser objetos ocultos e puzzles contendo ali um foco maior, não custava ao menos fazer o jogador se interessar pela história de verdade e não somente concluir uns objetos ocultos....ficou uma coisa seca, bem mesquinha e por mim não recomendo...é uma perda de tempo para quem gosta de se prender nas histórias, pra quem gosta de detalhes, desfecho, plot bem executado e esse não possui nada disso.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068165570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 196, 'playtime_forever': 2716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2715, 'last_played': 1674674508}

review: Hey, this is not as quite as long as the game time shows. I had to play through a second time in the regular game to mop up my achievements. This one makes you get them in the game and not from the mini-game guide. It would have been a third, but someone was kind enough to post a save game -- saved me several hours or so. I would have had to play the entire game through again just for one achievement -- Alchemist. Either way, this was your typical HO adventure. Mediocre story and acting, as well as graphics. Nothing too special. Be sure to grab it on a steep sale. Otherwise, I'd pass.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020049439', 'num_games_owned': 2611, 'num_reviews': 278, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1639825795}
review:
[h1]NO HAY MEJOR DEMONIO QUE EL DEMONIO CAZADO[/h1]

Pues otro juego de Objetos Ocultos y de Artifex Mundi, por lo que los más veteranos del lugar ya sabrán con lo que se van a encontrar. 

Y efectivamente este primer juego de la saga Demon Hunter, una de las más prolíficas de la desarrolladora, ni decepciona ni sorprende. Nos encontramos con el habitual juego de este género, es decir, muchos puzzles de escasa dificultad y una gran cantidad de objetos por encontrar. 

Una fórmula simple y resultona que siempre funciona si lo que se busca es un entretenimiento ligero, rápido y sin complicaciones. 

Para amenizar la partida el juego nos presenta la típica historia, muy melodrámatica y sobreactuada, donde tenderemos que cazar demonios y enfrentarnos al pérfido mal de turno, una mera excusa que hace las veces de hilo conductor entre tanto puzzle y tanto objeto oculto. 

Artifex Mundi es una de las desarrolladoras del género más pulcras y especializadas por lo que el resultado final de sus juegos suele ser de lo más satisfactorio... siempre que seamos conscientes de que se trata de un género menor con sus propias limitaciones. 

En ese sentido este primer Demon Hunter no decepciona y divierte según lo esperado. Un sencillo entretenimiento, ideal para esos momentos en los que no nos apetece implicarnos con un juego más largo y complejo, o simplemente para pasar algunos ratos muertos. 

RECOMENDABLE para los aventureros menos exigentes, los aficionados al género y los discípulos de John Constantine.

Totalmente PRESCINDIBLE para el resto de jugadores, sobre todo para los negacionistas del puzzle y los más miopes. 


6/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198867732317', 'num_games_owned': 1936, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1700812257}
review:
本作打分4/10分，不推荐。
首先剧情方面很无聊的剧情，勉勉强强过得去，但真的有点弱智，特别是那个住手，都能闪现消失了，你竟然还看不出他有问题，还怪怪地听话帮忙做事，醉了，然后封印解除后，Boss立马嘴遁，Flag立得飞起，你不解释别人可能还奈何不了你，装死等封印解除不好么，非要好么多话，逼着别人找你麻烦，然后是boss出来后，竟然还可以让主角随便乱逛，这么自大的么，你就不会控制你的人偶来阻止主角行动么，总之槽点满满。
解谜方面真的是一塌糊涂，首先基本全是寻物谜题，寻物完又是寻物，太恐怖了，然后是寻物谜题里的单词翻译，真的是一言难尽，有些翻译错误是一直以来都有的，磨刀石和卷笔刀，球棒和蝙蝠，这些还可以理解，但有些翻译真的是天马行空了，你水龙头翻译成了龙头，你这是同一个东西的么！真的难以理解。
然后音乐方面太单调了，而且一直都是那一首，寻物谜题的背景音乐就没变过，而且寻物谜题还特别多，听着特别烦，真的早就听腻了。
成就方面，这一作成就方面要求非常高，首次游玩想要全成就难度非常大，基本都是解谜限时成就，还有不出错成就，一旦错过了就没了，超时的话只能在谜题小游戏上把解谜步骤想好了练熟了，再开始二周目挑战吧。
总体而言，这一作解谜难度不是很大，谜题数量少，寻物谜题数量多的离谱，并没有特别出众的地方。

author: {'steamid': '76561199158292051', 'num_games_owned': 2792, 'num_reviews': 1619, 'playtime_forever': 506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 490, 'last_played': 1643810750}

author: {'steamid': '76561197972040704', 'num_games_owned': 1844, 'num_reviews': 725, 'playtime_forever': 174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1643768497}
review:
Hidden Object Games (HOGs) are a guilty pleasure of mine. They're kinda crummy, like B-movies, especially as far as the plot is concerned. However, while Demon Hunter (this is the first game in the series) does fall into that "B-movie" tier of game, it is neither enjoyable enough to be gaming junk food, nor is it "so bad it's good" as some HOGs have been (especially when the stories and cutscenes are positively bonkers).

Demon Hunter has a few decent moments, two of which got chuckles out of me (not intended to be funny by the devs, I can assure you), but the game feels more random than most HOGs. Suspension of disbelief when it comes to weird puzzles is par for the course in this genre, but Demon Hunter goes all the way on having strange things that don't fit in. Magical flowers grow in various parts of the house, even though there is no other sign of "magic" sprouting up in the house like this, nor are the flowers relevant to the plot or the visual theme of the demonic/magical element of the game. Oh, but you do need a special, magical dagger to cut the magical flowers. Because. And there's a kraken. And what looks like possibly an Atlantean undersea region. Because. Zero in-game lore is presented to explain any of this, and as I said, it didn't reach comedic levels for me, but rather, a "disconnect" in the setting.

There is less plot in this HOG than a lot of HOGs I've played, and the same liquid-pouring puzzle mechanics (pouring liquids back and forth from different-sized containers to get the right amount of liquid of the right color mixture) appears three or four times with different solutions each time. Demon Hunter has a bonus segment and it's one of the most pointless-feeling bonus segments I've played in a HOG thus far. A prequel would have been more interesting than this. The bonus is literally a dream, so there are about eight or so "rooms," and almost all of them have no connection to one another, nor are they thematically appropriate to represent either things the protagonist has encountered to manifest her fears or experiences into a dream, or some clear, cohesive force of influence on her dream (except more puzzles and hidden object sections). This part was even more random-feeling than the base game, and I was glad to be done with it.

This is not the worst HOG I've played, but I didn't particularly enjoy it, either from a good or so-bad-it's-good perspective. I would suggest passing on this one.

review: Had to play the first one after I enjoyed the 2nd in this Demon Hunter Series. For the most part I enjoyed the puzzles and story although it triggered my shark phobia at one point but that's a personal thing that made the game uncomfortable for me for short while. The rest thankfully all on dry land was fun. I liked the bonus part but it was hard to get some of the achievements on the first try. Onto the 3rd one now to see how the lore continues. Worth a play on sale naturally.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042620952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1382, 'playtime_forever': 719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 719, 'last_played': 1637016341}
review:
[h1] Genre [/h1] Ein Hidden Object Adventure

[h1] Story [/h1] Wir spielen eine Frau namens "Dawn Harlock" und haben erfahren das ein Professor ums Leben gekommen ist. Angeblich war es Mord und der Schuldige soll sein Assistent sein. Wir glauben dies aber nicht und fahren zum Ort des Geschehens (eine Einsame Insel) um dort herauszufinden was passiert ist und wer genau wir sind

[h1] Gameplay [/h1] Gameplay technisch unterscheidet sich dieses Spiel auch nicht von anderen Hidden Object Adventuren. Wir sammeln mal wieder wie üblich allerhand Gegenstände ein um diese dann irgendwo wieder einzusetzen. Zudem lösen wir Wimmelbildszenen und Minispiele/Rätsel. Diese sind ganz ordentlich gemacht und machen Spaß. Ich musste das Spiel allerdings aufgrund von Achievements 3 mal neu anfangen, was echt nervig war. Die Musik ist passend und das Voice Acting ist mal wieder Mäßig

[h1] Achievements [/h1] Es gibt insgesamt 28 Erfolge. Hierfür muss man u.a. das Spiel beenden und 4 verschiedene Arten an Collectibles einsammeln. Es gibt auch richtig ätzende Erfolge wie z.B. gewisses Minispiel/Rätsel in einer Minute oder teilweise sogar in 40 Sekunden lösen. Auch muss man bestimmte Minispiele/Rätsel ohne einen Fehler zu machen lösen

[h1] Pro/Contra [/h1]
+ Gute Story
+ Passende Musik
+ Nette Wimmelbildszenen
+ Nette Rätsel
+ Bonus Kapitel
+ Achievements
+ Sammelkarten

- Ein paar Übersetzungsfehler (merkt man besonders im Tutorial und in einer der Ersten Wimmelbilder sollte man eine Fledermaus suchen (Englisch = Bat). Tatsächlich musste man aber einen Baseballschläger finden (Englisch = Bat)

[h1] Fazit [/h1] Lässt man die Achievements außer acht, ist es ein wirklich gutes Hidden Object Adventure. Ich habe noch nie so ätzende Erfolge in einem Wimmelbildspiel gesehen. Nichts desto trotz kann ich es jedem Fan von Hidden Object Adventuren sehr Empfehlen weil das Spiel an sich sehr gut ist

author: {'steamid': '76561197993343077', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 974, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 974, 'last_played': 1634133072}
review:
Pitch classique de chez classique. Ce jeu, le premier de la série Demon Hunter, accuse cruellement son âge. Soc très très nombreuses qui cassent un rythme déjà lent, énigmes basiques, musique sans intérêt. Cet épisode n’a pour lui que d’être le 1er d’une série qui se révélera excellente.
En bref, cet épisode est totalement oubliable sauf à vouloir l’ensemble de la série.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089444776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1624683752}
review:
[b]Demon Hunter: Chronicles from Beyond.[/b] A hidden object mystery game following a woman with crimson-colored irises who sought to return to her paternal figure's house on an island. She comes back after an experiment within his laboratory led to his death, a demon left loose on his property; pressing forth to solve the mystery, she too hopes to understand who she is, or what she is.

[h1]Review[/h1]
Moving around Steam, I learned that there's a bunch of different hidden object games published by Artifex Mundi. Among them includes Enigmatis and Grim Legends, their games tend to have intriguing stories and compelling characters and situations that place the player within the eyes and ears of the protagonists. The artwork, environments, and even a few of the puzzles are often stellar.

With Demon Hunter, however, the game feels extremely lacking. Though the opening can come forth as attention-grabbing, to know who this is, what has them in this predicament. Her eyes red, the game tries to imply that she may have a connection to the game's potential antagonist or antagonists. Unfortunately, the moment after the opening cutscene concludes and the tutorial somewhat explains the mechanics of the game, its lacking qualities become apparent. 

The only characters that receive audible speaking are side characters that have limited presence or purpose in the story or progression: an old lady with a missing cat and a fishermen who lives in the nearby lighthouse. Their models feel like unnaturally animated stock images. Even the one character who is relevant to the main story gets an appearance mid-way into the game, he does not "speak" like the stock images; while animated in body movement, his mouth never opens but is audible in his pleas for your help. Additionally, the leading lady protagonist does not speak anymore past the first cutscene nor does the game display a dialogue prompt to her reactions to certain situations, especially whenever she encounters the shadowy demon that lurks the property or the scientist's assistant.

Being a point-and-click game for much of the game time, exploration of the environment are subpar, but some of the navigation for certain objects and items can be bothersome, especially when the player has to repeatedly move between areas with no way of knowing without constantly checking the map. Some of the puzzles in the game aren't great either.

The way this game was made me curious if giving the sequel or others under the "Demon Hunter" title were worth giving a try. Its somewhat mixed reception as well suggests that I might stick to a few other games published by Artifex Mundi.

[h1]Grading[/h1]

[tr]
[th]Specs[/th]

review: Played this on the easiest level and it was pretty easy. Still, I enjoyed the diversion of the game and would give it a solid 3.5 / 5.0 stars. Wasn't frustrating, had (maybe) one less-than-perfect translation of items to locate during the regular game and the puzzles weren't overly challenging. I did enjoy it and it was worth the $10 for several hours of entertainment. Would I play again? Sure, but it wouldn't be my first choice. I'd say this ranks pretty high.

author: {'steamid': '76561198409491837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1709444543}
review:
If you are really craving a HOG, then get this in a discount. It was way too short. The first 25% of it was quite boring. There were many mistranslations or typos in the hidden object scenes. (I don't mind one or two - I'm grateful they translates these into English at all.) But there were too many in this.

It's an older game. Some of those are better than the newer games, but I can't say the same for this one. There wasn't much of a story. The mini-games were very basic.

The art was nice and crisp, that's about the only thing I can say for it. (I don't care for the blurry watercolor-y style of many of the older games.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198057579119', 'num_games_owned': 4343, 'num_reviews': 303, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1616674070}
review: Biedne to, trzeba przyznać. Pierwsza część Łowcy demonów jest jedynie poprawna, a to zdecydowanie poniżej poziomu, do którego przyzwyczaił nas AM. Rozumiem, że seria jeszcze się "rozkręci", ale póki co będę mógł polecać tę część wyłącznie największym entuzjastom HOPA.

author: {'steamid': '76561198929512897', 'num_games_owned': 260, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1615397782}
review:
Not sure about this one. Music is short and repeats on a loop. Not very entertaining.
The scenes with hidden objects don't really make sense... the objects change sometimes into other objects - this is  very unrealistic as this doesn't happen in real life. I understand it's supposed to raise the difficulty a bit, but I think this wasn't the best way possible.
Graphics are nice, but for me the story was out of place and it seemed more like some random elements are placed together to create some story-line which doesn't really make any sense.
I would not say it's a bad game, I've enjoyed it, but unless you get it when it's on sale, I don't recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198845717264', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 196, 'playtime_forever': 865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 865, 'last_played': 1615195845}
review:
Thumbs down! There are achievements for finding collectible items. I’m not a big fan of pointless collectibles in general, but what really bothered me was that there was no indication within the game that you’re supposed to be looking for collectibles in the first place. I actually went through the tutorial, but the tutorial did not mention collectibles at all. That would have been the perfect place to mention it.

The hidden object scenes are mostly okay, but the names of some hidden objects were not correctly translated into English. There was an instant travel map in the main game, but there is no instant travel in the bonus chapter. It’s irritating when a game changes its own rules without any explanation. In addition, the bonus chapter repeats a mini-game from the main game. You can use the exact same steps to solve it, because they didn’t even bother to make the puzzle slightly different.

After completing the game once, I played it again to get all the achievements. The alchemist achievement was the hardest one to get. It’s not so much that getting it is hard, but it’s one of the last mini-games to solve and you only get one chance to beat the time limit, so if you miss it, then you have to replay nearly the whole game in order to try again. Either that, or figure out how to make backup copies of the save game files. I learned that the save game files were not stored on my computer since the game used Steam Cloud for saving progress. I was able to copy the save game files after I turned off Steam Cloud for this game. Then I got the achievement after a couple of tries without having to replay the whole game again. 

Note. My playtime might make it seem like there’s a lot of content, but I replayed the game twice in order to get all the achievements. One time was to get all the collectibles that weren’t mentioned at all. The next time was to be able to have save game files right before attempting the alchemist achievement. Also, there was about an hour or two when I was AFK (away from keyboard).

review: Il gioco in sé è anche carino, anche se ho apprezzato di più il successivo. Il grosso problema è la traduzione in italiano: molte parole sono state tradotte male, impedendo quindi la riuscita perfetta delle parti hidden object. A saperlo l'avrei giocato da subito in inglese: se volete fare una traduzione fatela almeno bene.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087491748', 'num_games_owned': 553, 'num_reviews': 300, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1613502125}
review:
There's nothing good in this game, The worst HOG i've played. Riddles are profoundly stupid - you need magic knife to cut flower or bees inside house...
Localization is tragedy.
Not worth playing even for free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009503230', 'num_games_owned': 1768, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 624, 'last_played': 1612744538}
review:
Un jeu d'objets cachés sympa de base mais la traduction française laisse sérieusement à désirer. Certains succès liés à des mini-jeux peuvent être délicats à réaliser et avec la sauvegarde automatique, nous sommes obligés de recommencer tout le jeu si on ne réussit pas ces succès-là.
Donc en l'état actuel des choses, et surtout dans la version française, je ne peux le recommander.
Et le prix est trop élevé vu la qualité du produit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146282713', 'num_games_owned': 6389, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 958, 'last_played': 1612065239}
review: 翻譯很多錯誤 , 例如明明是球棒翻成蝙蝠 , 找半天找不到 , 再加上有bug 3/3的成就解不了 , 還好看攻略解前面3個過了 , 但是最後煉金的70秒成就太扯了 , 除了是後期任務要跑很久 , 常常再倒藥水會有延遲 , 導致時間內很難跑完 , 跑了五次不想浪費時間 , 再加上又沒可模擬練習的 , 對想全成就的就很嘔

author: {'steamid': '76561198830819310', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1612008415}
review:
게임 엔딩 볼때마다 일일히 평가 작성하는게 너무 귀찮지만..
기록용으로 작성.
데몬헌터 시리즈 5탄까지 있는걸로 아는데 나머지 시리즈는 구입 안해야겠다고 마음 먹음.
Artifex Mundi 사지만 이렇게까지 졸릴수있나 싶은 구성.
물 양 맞추기를 우려먹다 못해 골수까지 빨아먹는 미니게임.
보너스챕터는 외계인의 연장선임을 티 내고 싶던건지 갑분꿈.
다른건 못해도 수집용은 꼭 채우는 편인데 수집욕구도 안들었다는 한줄평으로 평가 끝
도전과제 때문에 10시간 이상 하신분들 존경함 짝짝

author: {'steamid': '76561198023154119', 'num_games_owned': 5242, 'num_reviews': 316, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1610142104}
review:
Kolejny HOG od Artifexu - to dalej "to samo". Jak podobały się poprzednie gry, to ta też podejdzie...

...chyba. Bo miałem wrażenie, że to mogła być najsłabsza produkcja z tych, które już ograłem. U podstaw identyczna, do tego krótka, więc braki fabularne nie powinny aż tak przeszkadzać, ale jednak. Jeśli odpala się gry studia raz na jakiś czas, to i tę można zaliczyć.

Z różnic - niestety negatywne. Znaczące błędy w tłumaczeniu (glass to kieliszek zamiast szkiełko, więc powodzenia w szukaniu bez tej wiedzy), z mniejszych: jedna runa to według twórców "run", spiked ball zostało nieprzetłumaczone. W Ukrytych Przedmiotach mała zmiana, niektóre zmieniają wygląd - irytuje. Dodatkowa historia - z jakiegoś powodu tu nagle nie działa szybka podróż, do tego zagadki to dosłownie powtórka z głównej historii.

Najśmieszniejszy przypadek polskiej wersji: minigra z kompasem. W oryginale mamy poruszać się według kierunków NEWS, znany standard: N to North i tak dalej. Jak to rozwiązano u nas? Północ i Południe, więc instrukcja P-2... domyślcie się. Mapa jest mała, więc tragedii nie ma, ale i tak nie mam pojęcia, jak taki absurd dostał się do gry.

Chętnie wystawiłbym ocenę "może", pomiędzy tak i nie. Myślę, że mimo wszystko fani HOGów wyciągną z tego jakąś rozrywkę, więc niech będzie: taki niechętny, niepewny, ledwo wystający kciuk w górę.

author: {'steamid': '76561198800965012', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 190, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1609286810}
review: It's hard to rate this game. On one hand, I got it at 90% off. On the other, the game itself was quite tedious and didn't live up to Artifex Mundi's standard. This game is older and it really shows. I found myself getting bored playing it. However, although the main story wasn't as fun, the bonus story was a little better, certainly prettier than the main game at least. I'd say to only get this one if it's on sale or perhaps if you intend on playing the whole Demon Hunter Series. Or if you really like hidden object puzzles, since there were so many of them in it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084223806', 'num_games_owned': 1820, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1605136268}
review:
Demon Hunter is a pretty good hidden object/puzzle game.
It's just what I've come to expect from the games released by Artifex Mundi.
It's not excessively hard and, if you played any similar game before, the puzzles will be very familiar.
Still this is a good game to spend an evening playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198889870480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1603917690}
review: такое впечатление что руководил проектом человек, который хотел привлечь всех и сразу и охватить все и побольше. в итоге вышло говно, простите, мне очень жаль художников, которые это все рисовали. игра сделана очень халтурно в плане сюжета, намешали все что угодно и в итоге игра выглядит, как страница с объявлениями в дешевой газете - пестро и очень убого. отдельная критика на музыку - она вообще не соответствует атмосфере и откровенно раздражает. пожалуйста не делайте больше таких игр. игрокам нравится когда есть четкий сеттинг без мешанины эпох, архитектуры, жанров и вот этого всего винегрета. если сеттинг 18- 19 век, то не надо туда совать древнегреческие храмы и пиратские корабли из других эпох под водой куда тебе надо нырнуть ненадолго или какие-то майа с гепардами оно выглядит просто ужасно картонно и вообще не создает никакой атмосферы.
