author: {'steamid': '76561199000078579', 'num_games_owned': 734, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1602542947}
review:
(This game was a gift from a friend)

This game seems to have very little story, even for a HOG. You're a young woman who was adopted by a scientist when you were very young, the scientist dies and you immediately know through some kind of psychic link with him, and you go to his home to find out what happened and defeat the demon that did it. That's it. There's very little story in the in between.
It also features a kraken for some reason? Why is there a kraken and an Atlantis-esque cityscape in a game about stopping demons? I don't know, and I don't think the developers did either because it's only around for a few minutes.

• The artwork is... acceptable; it's certainly not the worst I've seen for a HOG although it's fairly low-def.
• The puzzles are ridiculously easy, although the achievements tied to them can be frustrating either due to controls or timing. (I'm looking at you, Lab Rat and Alchemist achievements ಠ_ಠ )
• There's a crazy amount of backtracking, but they at least provide you with a map that allows fast travel and shows you where you need to go if you're not playing on Expert.
• The names for HOS items are vague and sometimes strange, like calling a math compass a "divider" or asking you to find a "gimlet" (it's essentially a corkscrew). Some of them are also poorly translated, like "stetoskope" instead of "stethoscope"
• The voice acting is sub-par and the actual recordings are low quality, it sounds like the speaker is far away from you even when wearing ear buds.
• The bonus chapter was completely unnecessary, it added nothing but play time.

Overall, I'd have to say that the only reason to play this game is if you're planning on playing the sequels as well, although that opinion may change after I play them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164016063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 333, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1602527976}
review:
pros

+ good looking colorful background graphics
+ there is a map
+ good quality cut scenes
+ mini games mostly enjoyable. these are nor easy either difficult
+ hidden object scenes fun
+ hint system helpful
+ there is auto save
+ two difficulty options
+ voice acting is fine
+ there are steam achievements and cards
+ there are in game collectibles
+ there is bonus chapter

cons

- story is weak and not well developed
- generic and repetitive musics
- a few repetitive calculate based puzzle and frustrating mini games which i directly skipped
- game could have been longer

overall this is an enjoyable HO and puzzle game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198308946492', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1600862172}
review:
Nie polecam, chyba, że ktoś chcę po prostu przejść wszystkie gierki z tej serii. Wtedy doradzam kupić, jak już na promocji.
Niestety, chociaż uwielbiam tego rodzaju gry, ta mnie rozczarowała.

Plus:
- Fabuła
- Mapa, na której są zaznaczone miejsca gdzie coś jest.
- W głównej przygodzie można się przenosić za pomocą mapy.

Minusy:
- Zbyt wiele razy pojawiające się połyskujące miejsca, że tak to ujmę, gdzie szukamy rzeczy. Z czasem zaczyna się to robić bardzo nużące. Brak jakiejś innej formy jej przechodzenia.
- Kiepskie zakończenie dodatkowej przygody. 
- W dodatkowej przygodzie niestety nie można skakać z lokalizacji, na inną poprzez mapę.

Innymi słowy, pomysł miał potencjał, ale wykonanie, słabiutko.

author: {'steamid': '76561199026684266', 'num_games_owned': 4131, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1599552187}
review:
中译名为「狩魔者：不为人知的故事」，
一周目游戏时长约120～180分钟，
这是一部欧美风格立绘+推理解谜的视觉小说类游戏。

剧情上的叙事风格并不严谨，
偏欧美的手作画风和CG动画亦不符合东方的审美观，
但我仍然认为这部作品是值得推荐的。

毕竟乍看之下如此粗糙的一部作品，
作为游戏核心的推理解谜却设置得恰到好处。
谜面的鱼龙混珠和充足的提示，
以及允许跳过耗费脑力精力的小游戏，
把游戏的娱乐性和自主性的选择权，
交到了层次多样的玩家面前。
游戏开发者兼顾了热衷解谜的深度玩家，
以及不善解谜的轻度玩家两者之间的需求和解放。

对于如此为玩家的游戏体验设想的开发团队，
给予善意的推荐和支持，
是我作为一名愉快的把游戏进行下去的玩家，
所能表达的谦虚，以及致敬。

author: {'steamid': '76561198067593196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1636132051}
review:
Demon Hunter 1 ist eines der "älteren" Wimmelspiele, die ich bewerte. Das war ein Wimmelspiel, was mir sehr viel Spaß gemacht, obwohl es verhältnismäßig einfach daherkommt. Die Grafik, Videos, Animationen und die Musik, bzw. die Soundeffekte waren ganz okay, durchschnittlich.

Pro:
+ Spielzeit
+ Rätsel (Minispiele und Wimmelspiele) , ganz nach meinem Geschmack
+ Zusatzelemente (versteckte Objekte, Sammelbares)

Fazit:
Bei Kontra ist mir nichts Negatives aufgestoßen. Es ist ein absolut durchschnittliches Wimmelspiel. Dafür ist es aber ganz schön gut, und macht soweit Alles richtig.  Ich bin auf den 2. Teil gespannt, wie sich die Serie entwickelt.

Meine persönliche Hitrangliste:
1. Queen's Quest 1
2. Grim Legends 3
3. Grim Legends 2
4. Queen's Quest 2
5. The secret Order 7
6. Eventide 1
7. Enigmatis 2
8. Enigmatis 3
9. The secret Order 6
10. Eventide 2
11. The secret Order 8
12. Demon Hunter 1
13. Grim Legends 1
14. The secret Order 3
15. The secret Order 5
16. The secret Order 2
17. Endless Fables 1
18. The secret Order 4
19. Enigmatis 1

Nächstes Wimmelspiel: Demon Hunter 2

author: {'steamid': '76561197968995967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1591989376}
review:
Update: after playing the third game, I think everyone should just skip the first two games. They subtly rewrite some of the story and it seems like they basically took the general premise and theme and started over. The third game is actually good and feels like it was made by a completely different team. In my opinion you won't miss anything by skipping the two first games in this series.

Old review:

A very weak HO game. Usually the stories for these aren't that well developed, but here there almost weren't any writing. The artwork is so-so for the genre, and the puzzles and HO scenes were uninspired.

It lies on the very casual end of difficulty. This is not a detraction, just my observation. I don't mind easier HOGs if they can keep me otherwise engaged. This one didn't.

Finally there were a fair bit of typos, even for objects in the HO scenes, but they were simple and didn't pose any difficulty other than making the experience seem a tad unpolished. Example: calling a Harp for a Harph.

I picked the whole series up on sale already knowing the first one had Mixed reviews. It took me ~3 hours to complete the main story and the bonus chapter. I hope the next games offer a bit more, but I definitely wouldn't recommend getting this unless its 1) on sale and 2) you're a completionist who wants to play this series and therefore need the first to get started.

review:
Um pouco menos detalhado e mais simples que os outros, quem ta acostumado com Objetos ocultos não vai encontra nada tão novo.
Até tentam implementa uns itens que mudam de forma, mais de novo é isso !!

História não é bem desenvolvida e é meia tosquinha, mais nada demais já que objetos ocultos o foco esta nos itens e puzzles, e esses são bem fáceis de resolve.

Se gosta de objetos ocultos vai gostar, se não é tão fã: Não comece por esse !!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198254797380', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1590125704}
review: Auftakt der Reihe. Das Setting hat mir gut gefallen, mysteriöser Mord eines Professors in einer alten Villa. Sind da Dämonen am Werk? Die Story entwickelt sich über seltene Zwischensequenzen und es gibt wenige weitere Personen im Spiel. Das bleibt allerdings mager. Die Rätsel sind vergleichsweise einfach und können übersprungen und automatisch gelöst werden (allerdings gibt es dann keine Achievements). Es gibt zwei getrennte Kampagnen, Spieldauer zusammen ca. 5 bis 6  Stunden. Insgesamt empfehlenswert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052652299', 'num_games_owned': 6599, 'num_reviews': 333, 'playtime_forever': 480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1629100134}
review:
Un jeu classique dans son genre, mais qui reste efficace et plutôt sympathique.
Un bémol pour la traduction parfois bancale, et la présence de quelques erreurs d'orthographe, de grammaire et conjugaison. Certains mots ne sont également parfois pas traduits en français. Bon, rien de dramatique au final, l'essentiel est que l'on comprend bien l'histoire, mais ce sont des détails qui ternissent un petit peu le plaisir de jouer, sans pour autant le gâcher.
Terminer le jeu débloque une aventure bonus qui comporte pas mal de scènes d'objets cachés, mais elle n'est pas indispensable pour le développement de l'histoire.

[b]Il y a mieux, mais [i]Demon Hunter: Chronicles from Beyond[/i] est un jeu agréable, avec son lot de scènes d'objets cachés et énigmes, et une histoire qui révèle peu à peu ses mystères sans être exceptionnelle.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198177099229', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1581099401}
review:
Demon Hunter, buen juego que comienza tras la tipica desaparicion de una persona de rigor y te toca a ti, llevar a cabo una minuciosa investigacion..., asi da comienzo esta aventura, en la cual una mansion, queda encantada o poseida por una entidad demoniaca, con lo cual, nos toca a nosotros ser los que descubramos que ha pasado y llevar apunto y final a dicha magia malefica.

En esta aventura de objetos ocultos, he notado que la traduccion de casi todo es exacta, supongo que aqui ya se pusieron un poco mas en serio con la traduccion, los puzzles, hay algunos que son verdaderamente complicados si no sabes de cierto juego o si el raton falla con las pulsaciones...., esto ultimo a mi me fastidio en un puzzle, pero bueno, no pasa nada.

El argumento se desenvuelve bastante acorde segun vas avanzando y desbloqueando zonas para resolver el acertijo o puzzle en cuestion, graficamente bastante bien, sin nada que moleste la visualizacion correcta del juego y sus videos, y poco mas que añadir.

Su duracion aproximada es de 4 horas, minuto arriba, minuto abajo si es la primera vez que lo juegas, tal y como yo he echo, es una aventura de objetos ocultos bastante entretenida y que no te llevara mucho tiempo el completarla, asi que, aun buen precio, quizas en un paquete de juegos del mismo estilo, te sea mas barato y rentable que comprarlo directamente en Steam.

Adquisicion recomendada si te gusta el genero, y sobretodo, si esta a un buen precio.

author: {'steamid': '76561198294690561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1578063396}
review:
Мне жаль, что здесь есть только "Да" и "Нет". Насчет этой игры я бы сказала "Думайте сами".
Если коротко и в циферках.
Графика 10/10
Геймплей 6/10
Сюжет 7/10
Перевод 6/10

Теперь я поподробнее изолью свою боль (или восторг).
Графика. Да. Все прекрасно. Игра заметно старше моего и засчет этого несколько... мыльная. Но это прямо нисколько не мешает. Всё красиво. 3D добавлено адекватно и не бесит. [spoiler]Жалко только не было баталии акулы с кракеном визуально.[/spoiler] В бонусе есть вкладка с дизайном. И половина показанных там концепт-артов офигеннее, чем то, что выбрано в итоге. Жаль. Но это чисто вкусовщина, конечно. Просто мне понравились те, а не эти.
Геймплей. Это поиск предметов, друзья. Основа здесь - поиск предметов. Это первая игра из десятка, который я прошла в эти праздники, в которой поиск предметов меня откровенно задолбал. Наверное, причиной тому является то, насколько разработчик "удачно" его организовал. Ладно бы, его просто много (а чего мы можем хотеть от игры в поиск предметов, собственно?). Но там слишком часто встречается ситуация, когда у тебя написано, например "бутылка". И там этих бутылок штуки три. Пойди пойми, какую они имеют в виду. И так не только с бутылками. За игру (+бонус) три головоломки на смешивание и отмеривание жидкости. И, божечки, они все на получение одних и тех же пропорций! Я начала орать насчет этого со второй же. Из хорошего. в основном головоломки приятные и решаемые, что не может не радовать. Достижения можно получить за одну игру, если постараться. Лично я не справилась, но это все равно возможно.
Сюжет. Ну... опять же, ничего неожиданного. Простой сюжет, который наверняка можно прочитать в других обзорах. Радует, что демон не похож на Ктулху (да-да, это моя личная боль).
Перевод. Боль. Боль. Боль. Пара опечаток, признаться, штука не страшная (хотя когда Кракен внезапно стал Кареном - вот это было сильно). А вот когда в режиме поиска предметов (ПОИСКА ПРЕДМЕТОВ!!!) на слово "Стакан" ты находишь линзу, на слово "Веер" - вентилятор... потом мозг ломается, когда ты, если сразу предмет найти не можешь, мгновенно начинаешь подозревать, что опять что-то назвали не так. Так что с переводом тяжко...

Отдельно отмечу озвучку. Когда я услышала глубокий голос Александра, я была готова простить ему всё. И не только ему. Всей игре. Жалко, его там немного.[spoiler] И жалко, что его не спасти.[/spoiler]

В общем, игру рекомендую, но почитайте и подумайте, насколько сильно вас будут бесить указанные мной нюансы.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060190845', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1578000184}
review: Sympatique, mais il y a beaucoup d'erreur de traduction!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960393604', 'num_games_owned': 2763, 'num_reviews': 243, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1577941085}
review:
Even among these Artifex Mundi games, this is a bad one.  The animations, what little they are, are on the low end of this fare.  The hidden object puzzles have objects that will randomly swap between two things - one being what you need, the other being garbage, meaning you can only click on them when they're in the right form.  That's already fairly intolerable.  Some of the puzzles are not the least bit intuitive, requiring more trial and error than anything else.  There is sub-par voice acting at parts, particularly the thickness of the main character's accent.  The story is beyond nonsensical.  There are some typos sprinkled throughout the hidden object puzzles, particularly in the bonus chapter.

And yes, I get that these games are the video game equivalent of the cheap romance novels bored housewives pick up at the grocery store, but this one is particularly bad even when compared to the others.  The only saving grace I would give it is that at least it didn't have any puzzles that could be rendered unsolvable, at least not that I saw.

review: Interesting story line, I'm hoping that all the sequels continues the story?  If so, that's great.  (if not, I will be amending this review LOL)  This game wasn't too hard.  I was able to AFK or tab out and come back and pick up right where I left off as it was usually pretty apparent what you needed to do next.  The graphics seem a bit dated, but this is an older game, so if you're playing in Windowed mode, it's not so bad.  Seeing as how most of the sequels are rated pretty well, I'm looking forward to continuing this story!

author: {'steamid': '76561198043162376', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1578431799}
review: I like all of these Demon Hunter games.  They all have good graphics, music, and sound effects.  This is the first Demon Hunter game.  It doesn't have the best graphics when compared to Demon Hunter 3.  The artwork inside the mansion looks amazing, but the locations are probably 1024 x 768 resolution.  My only complaint with the game is that the map isn't easy to find.  You have to click on that little compass next to the journal to open the map.  The map does have fast travel.  The story for this game is not that complicated.  A demon from another dimension is tormenting people.  You have to get rid of the demon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138524551', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1577235129}
review:
Started out decent, but then it got quite dull.. The story just went from interesting to meh... And the amount of HoGs, hecc. There's one in nearly every scene. I do know it's a hidden object puzzle game, but there was A LOT of HoGs.
This first installment in the Demon Hunter-series has actually put me off the rest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198821234868', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1987, 'last_played': 1577561800}
review: No está nada mal, aunque la historia no es que sea lo más novedoso de que visto. Tiene algún fallo que puede incomodar bastante a la hora de jugar. Uno de los mayores inconvenientes puede ser la traducción, es mejorable en muchos de los textos, hasta el punto de no enterarte muy bien que debes buscar. Entiendo que quieren ahorrar, pero no cuesta demasiado poner a un traductor de castellano para que corrija los errores. Por este problema se puede poner el juego en inglés y jugar más cómodamente. Las escenas al menos la gran mayoría son decentes, he visto varias a la que ni le han puesto mucho cariño y eso se nota a la hora de buscar. De todos modos es un juego interesante, el primero de una saga que ya veremos cómo va desarrollándose a nivel argumentativo, pero que en principio no parece una mala historia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068169042', 'num_games_owned': 1435, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1575288628}
review:
The story is about solving the problem with evil entity that appeared after experimets of the professor. During the adventure you will discover the true about your identity. This idea is not original but the story is well done and they use specific places of the island. This tale is not so thrilling despite the fact that there are lightnings, fog, crazy scientist, dripping water, dark places in the cellar and mysteryous attic, but yes there is good atmosphere. Some of the places are unlogic but generally they are connected quite well and the story is working. Some of the minigames was original but usually the common ones but with quite good setting. HOS are made very well. Colourful, big items, correct ratios, nice resolution, items really connected with the place and story. I really like the morphing items idea. I had few times problem identify object by the name. It was a little difficult to get "no misclick" achievement. I was not bored during the game or at the end.
My recomendation is above average YES. Published 2014. Story and everything works, nice HOS, quite good atmosphere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072113884', 'num_games_owned': 877, 'num_reviews': 222, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1575252777}
review:
Demon Hunter: Chronicles from Beyond isn't a bad hidden object game. The puzzles are not as ridiculously hard as some (hey, I'm hear for the hidden object part, not concentric circle puzzles). In fact they're mostly downright easy. The story is kinda corny as is so common with these games, but it was entertaining. 

Unlike many other Artifex Mundi titles, you don't have to play through the same story multiple times in order to get all the achievements. That's a good thing. With so many games to play, I see little point in playing most of them twice! 

The cutscenes/movies are deplorably bad. Like, they really put no effort into it at all. The graphics otherwise are ok though. The music is tolerable but not outstanding. I can't speak to the rest of the series (yet), but this is an ok starter. If you like HoG's, there's better ones, but this is worthwhile. Get it on sale. 

+ Decent if slightly silly story
+ All achievements work properly and there is no requirement to play more than once
+ Music did the job
+ Nice hidden object scenes with reasonable graphics, tho some scenes have items that change - and it's slightly annoying when it changes right as you click it and you have to wait. It's an unneeded feature. 

- Cut-scenes are of deplorable quality
- I've seen tiny Inde games with better voice over

author: {'steamid': '76561198122258825', 'num_games_owned': 3711, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 846, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1625445606}
review:
[list][*][b][h1]Morlan's shorts:[/h1][/b][/list]
Silly and boring plot, annoying "extras" i.e. find leaves/coins etc hidden in the picture just to get 5 of them without any purpose, items in the HO games are frequently hard to distinguish, there's an annoying "feature" that an item will vanish and reappear (you just have to wait for it to blink back) which is just time wasting and some very annoying achievements like "finish tutorial" (what a waste of time), get a few HO games without misclick (!)..really now..
Some of the mini-games were fun although nothing new but in total it just wasn't fun because of these stupid ideas..
Play one of the others instead..

[b]Don't waste more time reading lengthy reviews.. time is of the essence![/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198065669694', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1604080195}
review:
Leider gibt es einige Übersetzungsfehler bei den Wimmelbild Szenen. 
Es wird eine Fledermaus gesucht und das Objekt ist ein Baseballschläger.
Es wird eine Mutter gesucht und das Objekt ist ein Blitz.......
Wie soll man da den Erfolg schaffen?
Die Geschichte ist ziemlich "Mau" dargestellt. 
Man kann es spielen ist aber nicht das, was man sonst von Artifex Mundi kennt.
Für ein Achievement muss man ein neues Spiel starten. 

Wenn das Game im Angebot ist, kann man zuschlagen (80%). Den vollen Preis würde ich nicht zahlen.

review: Başka bir Artifex oyunu.Başlangıçtaki karakterin sesi itici geldi ama sonradan konuşmuyor başka.Devamında hikaye normal,mini oyunların bazıları güzel,resim tıklamalarda hassasiyeti güzel,uğraştırmadı.Grafik/resim güzel.Oynanabilir bir tıklama oyunu bence.Biraz kısa hikayesi,ben de resimler zamanımı aldı.Mesela bir resimde bat için "Sopa" kullanmış ki ben yarasa ararken,diğer resimde de bat demiş ama bu sefer de yarasa idi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101776626', 'num_games_owned': 5243, 'num_reviews': 459, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1566450752}
review:
This game suffers from the "there are several amount of the item I request you to find" syndrom. 
They asks for coins ? You'll find 5 different items you can easily consider as being coins. They ask for a flask ? You can check my screenshot about that game where there are easily more than 20 flasks on the desk.
It makes it really hard to get one of the achievement requiering 0 hint and 0 missclick on 3 Hidden Object Scenes. I'm ok trying to take up that sort of challenge, but the system of adding a lot of similar items and requesting the player to guess the right one makes it more punishing than anything else.

Beside that it's a classic HOG, some of the puzzles are really really easy, others are punishing just for the sake of it (aka the labyrinth which reset if you touch a wall).
You have to click on the ? at the bottom right to get the instructions of the puzzle, which I admittedly dislike a lot, let's hope the next opus of the series will be better.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983693456', 'num_games_owned': 1515, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1566457744}
review:
저렴하게 산 게임 번들중 하나였었는데, arifex사것들을 나름 재밌게 해서..

스토리가 별로 중요한것도 아니고 전작들도 그리 중요하게 부각된건 아니라서 그냥 복합적이지만 한번 해봤다


그런데.. 이 게임 진짜 심각하다 왜 복합적인지 알거 같다

전작들은 빈약하긴 해도 나름 필요성과 목적을 가지고 퍼즐을 풀고 헤쳐나갔는데

이 게임은 뭐랄까 진짜 목적성이 희박한 느낌이다 내가 전문가도 아니고 글쟁이는 커녕 가방끈도 짧은 무식쟁이라

자세히 명확하게 설명을 할수 없는데, 게임을 하는 동안 내내 지루한 느낌이었다.


전작들의 스토리들도 어디서 많이 본, 심지어 표절 냄새가 솔솔 나는 게임인데도 나름 재밌게 했는데,

이건 너무 심각하다.. 


이 게임사 게임들은 번역들이 가끔 번역기 돌린거마냥 못알아먹게 번역한것들이 많은데,

이 게임사 게임들을 하면서 진행이 막힐정도로 해석이 잘못된건 처음이었다.

숨은 그림 찾기에서 아무리 찾아봐도 "장갑"이 안보여서 답을 찾아보니

"지구본"이란다 아무래도 "Globe(지구본)"을 "Glove(장갑)으로  잘못보고 해석한듯 하다;;;

이를 보니 번역기를 돌리는거 같진 않고 사람이 일일이 다 번역하는거 같긴 하다;;

author: {'steamid': '76561198052802708', 'num_games_owned': 1437, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1535239845}
review:
Upon the death of her mentor Professor Ashmore, Dawn returns to his home to discover what has transpired. And so starts the supernatural mystery that is Demon Hunter.

[list][h1]Pros[/h1]
[*]Excellent flow and pacing
[*]Good variety of puzzles
[*]Extremely atmospheric
[*]Variety in Hidden Object scenes

[h1]Cons[/h1]
[*]Tonal shifts are abrupt and disconcerting
[*]Puzzles are a little too easy
[*]Story is incredibly passe
[/list]
Despite it's Judeo-Christian trappings [i]Demon Hunter: Chronicles from Beyond[/i] distinctly distances itself from the mythology that is still integral to its concepts. It's abrupt switches to Greco-Roman mythology and then modern science don't fit together well. This pastiche of traditions it tries to use are disconnected and no attempt to integrate them is made. It feels like they've simply taken a series of images and settings and lumped them together on the basis of what they felt like doing on different days. Which is an incredible pity because when the game is presenting its empty mansions and dark corridors it is gorgeously evocative. Small homages to classic horror are tucked and hidden away such as carnivorous plants directly out of [i]Little Shop of Horrors[/i] amongst others. Much of the early exploration is incredible. From skirting around the outside of the house navigating its extensive gardens and finally into the first opulently dressed interiors feels like a step into a horror story. To be certain much of the ideas used are recycled from the classics but its implemented well, even if not revolutionary in execution. 
The occasional encounters with a stereotypically draped sorcerer lend some much needed tension in these areas. Because as is so often the case with Hidden Object Adventures the slow gameplay often drags and destroys any build up. This of course is all tied into the fact that the story is about as dreary as you get. 

For a supernatural mystery game, there isn't much mystery. The game visually bludgeons you with hints, dumping the plot via poorly rendered cutscenes (they simply distort the images to appear as if they are moving rather than actually animating them) and giving away clues in the most obvious fashion. What atmosphere is built up by the gorgeous locations is lost in the ridiculousness that is Dawn's stupidity. This is immensely frustrating. Video game characters are essentially puppets for the players use... crafting a playable character is often a delicate balance of allowing them personality through mechanics or the use of individual expression during dialogue. HoGs don't deliver on this, and Dawn as an interesting character with agency is left floundering. She's stupid, irresponsible with items and utterly unobservant to the most glaring clues. This is incredibly frustrating when you the player are by proxy also apparently so unobservant, and any ability you gift her to solve puzzles or find intriguing objects is undermined by Dawn's inability to see even the most obvious facts as the plot unfolds.

The gameplay also suffers at numerous points. Many of the aspects to advance the quest suffer from item collection and basic fetch quests. This ends up manifesting as tedious trekking back and forth again and again. At one point the game sends you back to the same location after you've just visited it to complete a puzzle. Its incredibly poor design and ends up feeling tedious and pathetic. The Hidden Object scenes themselves are not too bad though. They are varied with different types of searches such as silhouette or word lists and the objects are carefully disguised blending into the backgrounds in imaginative ways. The puzzles are stock standard from the Artifex Mundi Spark Casual Engine's repertoire. A concerning issue as the engine seems to encourage lack of creativity in developers who just make new visuals to go over the top of the puzzles in each iteration of their games. This makes them fairly boring to play, and this is even worse since many of the puzzles selected are the ones you encountered at school as extension work for logical thinking. 

The combination of poor characterisation through gameplay, over the top obviousness and mundane implementation of puzzles make [i]Demon Hunter: Chronicles from Beyond[/i] a dull experience that even the beautiful imagery can't uplift. Only worth a purchase if you are an incorrigible HoG enthusiast.

[h1]Score ~5/10~

author: {'steamid': '76561198033388937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 294, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1559094539}
review:
Good, reasonably straightforward HOG.
Fairly average, graphics are decent for an older game.  I liked the low-key, atmospheric music.
There isn't really an in-depth story, here. I got the game because I wanted the set.  That said, it was better than I expected, given the reviews.

Pros:
Lots of HOPs, all decent.  
The minigames are the usual mix; mostly okay, if not inspired.
Good music.
All the usual mod-cons, like a map and quick travel between locations.

Cons:
Completely linear, and you can't really call it a "story".
I felt sorry for the shark.
A few difficult achievements - and you have to restart game if you make an error on the key minigames (for the achievements).

Note:  The later games in the series build on the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161279682', 'num_games_owned': 1731, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1186, 'last_played': 1558984381}
review:
Si pudiera darle un voto neutro esa sería mi valoración. El juego no destaca en nada, los escenarios con objetos ocultos no son temáticos, están llenos de basura visual sin sentido y los demás minijuegos ninguno es original sino q son copias de sus otros juegos. Y para peor su historia es casi nula.

Pero bueno, igual le doy un voto positivo porque tampoco es para darle uno negativo, me sirvió para pasar la tarde.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176879271', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 640, 'last_played': 1555098136}
review:
Well, where to start? 

[h1] The story [/h1]
is pretty much non-existent and the plot is so incredibly obvious it's almost painful ( [spoiler] oh, that dude is teleporting around turning into black smoke, that’s not suspicious at all [/spoiler] ); most of it is ‘told’ through a book at the end, it feels rushed, like they had no more time and money so they just cut it there. The bonus chapter is ok, seems pretty random, but I like that it really is a bonus to the story, not one of those ‘buy the collector’s edition to get the full story’ ones.

[h1] Minigames [/h1]
are incredibly easy, the classic ‘turn to make all petals one color’ for example comes without the usual challenge of only being able to move the wheel in steps of 2 or 3 per click, instead you just go one further in both directions, so it’s pretty much a no-brainer. Also, the ‘make some kind of potion by mixing colors and adding a specific amount by filling them into flasks that are a different size of course’ minigame ( [strike] best description ever, I know [/strike] ) appears like three times in very slight variations (also also, if having a lab setup in a suitcase is not already questionable enough, putting a drain in there really completes the picture).

[h1] HO scenes [/h1]
include morphing objects as well as ones that require extra steps to get them; they are marked in the same color in the list below but the morphing ones change color as they appear/turn, this adds a little challenge which is nice.
Every scene is reused at least 2, mostly 3 times and reactivates pretty much randomly, so you end up with the ‘re-check every room continuously’ routine. It can also be really frustrating when you already see an item you know you need/already collected n/5 of but can’t take yet. The items you have to look for are variable, so it’s not the same each playthrough. Scenes stay like you left them when you replay them, the items you collected last time don’t reappear as far as I’ve noticed.

[h1] The artwork [/h1]
is ok, though it seems a little more comic-y than usual and the edges of things are kind of frizzy. HO scenes can be a little blurry but you can still make out the items just fine.

[h1] Achievements [/h1]
are mostly easy to get but most of them can only be collected in a playthrough as you cannot play all minigames separately afterwards! This is especially annoying for the three towards the end of the game as you either have to replay the entire game or create/download a new savegame.

[h1] The german translation [/h1]
is terrible and sounds like google translator. Some HO items are translated the wrong way (for example, 'bat' is translated to 'Fledermaus' even though the bat in the pic is a 'Baseballschläger'), the sentence structures remain unchanged and therefore sound weird in german and the tutorial is a complete and utter unintelligible mess.

[h1] Playtime-wise [/h1]
it's average if played 'properly'; if you take your time to search and collect, don't skip, don't use hints and play on hard difficulty (aka no markings on the map), it takes about 4 hours, possibly longer if you get stuck. You can quite easily rush through it however, which can also be useful regarding achievements.

[h1] All in all [/h1]
I didn’t encounter any bugs or glitches, but the travelling via map doesn’t always register and is pretty laggy sometimes. 
It generally is a pretty easy HOG, so it might be a good 'beginner's game' for someone who's new to the genre.

[h1] Tl;dr: [/h1] Better than I expected after reading the reviews, nothing spectacular but an okay game, buy on sale due to general averageness.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130262111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 261, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 554, 'last_played': 1560758068}
review:
Demon Hunter 1 ha estado bien. Se mantiene en la misma línea de calidad, que otros juegos de Búsqueda de Objetos de Artifex Mundi. 
Su historia es excesivamente simple, debido a que no esta tan trabajada como otros videojuegos de la misma compañía.
Respecto a los puzles, hay alguno nuevo, pero el resto ya les serán familiares a los seguidores.
La traducción aceptable, aunque debo reconocer, que he tenido que usar el Google, para identificar algunas palabras de culto. ¿De dónde ha salido el traductor? ¿De la Real Academia de Lengua Española?
El diseño de los dibujos, está bastante bien. 
Ofrece contenido extra para descargar, banda sonora, fondos de pantalla y una expansión de la aventura.
Posee logros y cromos Steam.
No me gusta la idea, que ha día de hoy, los posteriores juegos Demon Hunter (a excepción de Demon Hunter 2), no estén traducidos al español. ¿Porque narices Artifex Mundi no lo pone en nuestro idioma?
Si eres amante de los Juegos de Búsqueda de Objetos, te sugiero hacerte con Demon Hunter 1. 
Debido a que el juego carece de violencia, es apto para todos los públicos.
Solo cómpralo, si lo ves al precio de 1€, formando parte de un bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198260664413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1554758869}
review: Je dirais bof, pour ce jeu. Je m'explique, tout d'abord ( la traduction n'est vraiment pas bonne) exemple= "diviseur de printemps" pour le jeu c'est "un compas" pour nous. Je note rarement en négatif, mais pour etre franc, il y en à des mieux.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002506911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 415, 'playtime_forever': 816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 816, 'last_played': 1553494352}
review:
Finally finished the achievements.

The game plays as a great hidden object puzzle adventure game.  Good graphics, easily forgotten story, but still a good experience for the genre.  Only sticky area for this game is that for a casual game it offers a couple timing achievements one of which was fairly difficult and took a few tries.  Overall, they are all accessible, and if you're not an achievement hunter, then no problem, as the game itself does not time your puzzle mini-game.

review: 剧情单薄没有逻辑，不知道是我傻还是女主傻，好多行为理解不了。寻物迷题又臭又多，好多因为翻译根本没法找，明明都看到了两个关键道具，非要分成两个寻物迷题来拿。

author: {'steamid': '76561198263249107', 'num_games_owned': 4496, 'num_reviews': 736, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1548145039}
review:
Продолжение истории охотницы на демонов.  Игра с головоломками и поиском предметов, в которой вы будете расследовать смерть профессора, заменившего отца главной героине.

Сказать, что сюжет слаб, это ничего не сказать. Его по-сути нет. Сначала мы видим как сомнительный профессор и его сомнительный помошник проводят сомнительный научный эксперимент, в результате которого выпускают сомнительного демона и весь эксперимент заканчивается сомнительно. Главная героиня приезжает в особняк профессора (ну да, профессора же живут шикарно, особенно сумасшедшие) и пытается расследовать смерть приёмного отца. На этом всё. Вся игра проходит без сюжета, в конце героиня рассказа находит демона, который тут же ей всё рассказывает о сомнительном конце профессора, как и кусок дневника профессора, рассказывает о том с чего всё началось. Демон отправляется обратно, ГГ отправляется в кому.  Маловато для того, что бы называться сюжетом, не так ли?

Однако, игра порадует вас множеством разнообразных головоломок, сценами поиска предметов и обыденной нелогичностью взаимодействия с предметами и поступков ГГ. Мы не можем сохранить зажигалку и выбрасываем ей после зажжения лампы, поэтому что бы зажечь свечу в следующей локации мы будем искать спички, мы не можем раздвинуть траву или убрать паутину руками, поэтому нам потребуется коса и веник.  Но это уже почти что классика жанра подобных игр, так что, не будем обижаться и расстраиваться.

Поиск предметов в игре присутствует не только в соответствующих сценах, но и вообще по локациям в целом. Поэтому ознакомьтесь с коллекционными предметами, которые нужно собрать, что бы получить достижения, потому что с какого-то момента вы не сможете вернуться в первый набор локаций. Мне пришлось играть второй раз, что бы собрать их все. Ну и для того, что бы получить достижения по некоторым головоломкам.

Головоломки не сильно сложные, но некоторые требуют терпения. Графика красочная, добротная. Музыка фоном идущая подходит к антуражу. В общем и целом игра оставляет положительные впечатления, несмотря на некоторые недостатки логики и сюжета.  Поклонникам жанра рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198396048245', 'num_games_owned': 452, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 938, 'last_played': 1561737973}
review: La historia es bastante floja, demasiado para mi gusto, creo que les ha faltado ideas o que han ido rápido y sin dedicar tiempo a pensar. El resto del juego a pesar de lo comentado se puede decir que está bien, los puzzles y objetos tienen una cierta calidad, me gusta mucho la tematica de los objetos, tiene un cierto aire oscuro muy interesante que no es muy común en estos juegos. Un juego recomendable dentro de lo que cabe y que le ha faltado un poco mas de tiempo para estar bien acabado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198812162622', 'num_games_owned': 1210, 'num_reviews': 264, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1547422610}
review:
This is a pretty mediocre HO game with supernatural influences.  I got bored pretty quickly with the dull story.  The bonus chapter was even worse!
Graphics were average with some scenes outstanding.  There wasn't consistency right across the board.  HO scenes were ok, but some objects were hidden too well and very miniscule.  I needed a magnifying glass at times on my laptop!
Music was repetitive with a piano playing the same chords over and over again!  Voiceovers were average.
My main beef was the translation and spelling.  I know this is a foreign company, but surely they knew someone who could proofread the English for them?  At times, it was laughable!  Sorry guys.
Journal was good, best feature of the game.  Map and fast travel was good.  Story and graphics let the game down.  I know this is the first game of a series, so I hope they learned from their mistakes in future games.  It is not a terrible game, just lacks a spark.
I played on casual mode and it took me 5 hours to do main game and bonus chapter.  Definitely buy on sale.  Scrapes in for a recommendation.  5.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091927014', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1545944222}
review:
Ziemlich kurzes Wimmelbildspiel, aber die Artworks sind mal wieder sehr schön. Die animierten Sequenzen ... naja. Zehn Euro für den Grafikdesigner, sag ich mal.

Die Wimmelbilder sind sehr schön gemacht und auch nicht zu einfach. Ausgeglichen trifft es gut. Es gibt nach der Hauptstory noch einen Bonus, der mir ganz gut gefallen hat.

Die Minispiele sind durchwachsen. Zwei musste ich überspringen, da es partout nicht hingehauen hat, aber ich war vllt einfach zu doof :D Sie sind zum großen Teil wirklich gut und es sind nicht zu viele (wie bei Grim Tales *hust*).

Einziges Manko: manche Tonsequenzen sind dermaßen laut oder nervig, dass ich den Ton an manchen Stellen runterdrehte. Die Musik an sich ist stimmig und gefiel mir. Synchro war auch in Ordnung.

Fazit: Es ist kein over-the-top-Wimmelbildspiel, aber da ich das eh in irgendeinem Bundle mit drin hatte, hat es sich bestimmt gelohnt. Ich hatte ca. 2-3 Stunden Freude daran.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004233477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1538440054}
review:
This game is only four years old and already showing its age.

- There are a good number of hidden object puzzles (HOP) but they are muddy, usually the kind that involve photographs collaged together, although I think there were a few that had handmade art
- There are four kinds of collectibles
- There are a few achievements that were really terrible, namely, the ones that involved speedily solving a puzzle, which realistically could not be done without a guide in most cases. There's an achievement for clicking 'hint' 40 times, which I don't understand (how is that an achievement?) and there's an achievement for beating a maze in one try. This means holding the mouse button down as you carefully navigate the maze. However, if your cursor hits a maze wall, the game counts that as a miss, and you have to start the maze over from the last maze checkpoint (red dots on the green line that represents your path through the maze. The maze wall detection system is busted. I went through the game again just to get this achievement and it thought I hit a wall when no part of my cursor hit it, so I had to restart the entire game to get the achievement, from the beginning. The puzzle takes 30-60m to get to, so if you mess up any of the time related puzzle achievements, you end up wasting a ton of time trying to get back to those puzzles.
- The plot is okay, but it's not really about hunting demons as much as stopping them from coming through a portal. It's more about stopping a Lovecraftian cultist than about any kind of Gothic demon hunting. You aren't exactly Van Helsing in the game.

For reasons even unbeknownst to me, I am trying to beat every Artifex Mundi game, and that inclodes all the games in the Demon Hunter series. Unfortunaetly, the series is not off to a strong start!

스토리가 빈약하고 숨은그림 찾기가 조악하다.
유사 게임들에 비해서 편의성 부분에서 맵을 바로 이동할 수 있는 점 하나정도는 장점으로 볼 수 있지만, 그 외에 나머지 요소들은 쓸모없는 반복플레이를 필요로 한다. 장르 특성 상, 반복 플레이에서 얻을 수 있는 재미요소가 없기 때문에 그 부분은 정말 에러. 오히려 이전에 출시한 게임들보다 퀄리티가 떨어진다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972416553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 253, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1534311934}
review:
I love Artifex Mundi hidden object games, but find a lot of the games developed by other houses and published by Artifex Mundi pretty bad. Unfortunatly this game doesn't break with tradition.

Odd ill fitting music sets the scene, with beautiful drawn images that are hodged podged together to form an incoherent and non-nonsensical plot. It would have been better if it was just a load of random hidden object scenes.

So I can not in good faith recommend this game. There are many other better hidden object games available. 4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198036328736', 'num_games_owned': 3959, 'num_reviews': 727, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1529765818}
review:
Premier épisode de la série [i]Demon Hunter[/i], ce jeu d'objets cachés est une des premières réalisations du studio serbe Brave Giant, spécialisé dans ce genre, à qui l'on doit notamment aussi la série [i]Queen's Quest[/i]. Les deux séries ont sorti leur 4ème épisode au début 2018 et sont toujours éditées par Artifex Mundi.


[h1]Scénario[/h1]
Le Pr Ashmore est assassiné dans sa résidence d'Iowa Island alors qu'il menait des expériences sur ce qui semble être des portails dimensionnels. Son assistant Alexander Vor a disparu et est logiquement désigné comme suspect.
Dawn Harlock, l'héroïne du jeu, a été recueillie et élevée par Ashmore et décide de retrouver le coupable.
L'affaire va très vite prendre un tournant surnaturel et interroger Dawn sur sa propre identité.

Un court chapitre Bonus, excessivement composé de SOC, prolonge un peu l'aventure


[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Un peu d'exploration, de nombreuses SOC, des mini-jeux très habituels et plutôt faciles, des objets à utiliser de la bonne façon, un inventaire et un système d'aide : on est vraiment dans la forme la plus classique des jeux d'objets cachés.
Petite particularité, certains objets qu'on doit trouver dans les SOC changent d'apparence pour compliquer un peu leur localisation.


[h1]Direction artistique[/h1]
Certains environnements sont acceptables mais les SOC sont franchement moches et les animations font globalement très [i]cheap[/i].


[h1]Aspects techniques[/h1]
Le jeu n'est vraiment pas très ambitieux sur ce plan-là et même si on a vu largement pire dans le genre et qu'il n'y a pas de bug à signaler.
Par contre, toujours de nombreux exemples de traduction française farfelue, surtout dans les SOC.


[h1]Evaluation finale[/h1]
C'est certes peut-être le premier jeu du studio Brave Giant qui en a fait plusieurs bien mieux que ça depuis, c'est quand-même assez décevant de trouver un jeu d'aussi médiocre qualité chez Artifex Mundi.

En-dehors du fait qu'il n'impressionne ni sur le plan technique, ni sur le plan artistique, il n'apporte surtout rien d'original non plus dans le scénario ou dans les énigmes. 
On retrouve donc des mini-jeux vus et revus et on se retrouve dès le départ à devoir trouver un balai pour nettoyer une petite toile d'araignée (parce qu'on ose évidemment pas mettre la main dedans alors qu'on est prêt à sauver l'humanité), à devoir chercher de l'huile parce qu'il y a un truc rouillé qui coince (alors que même la salade on peut la manger sans huile), à devoir compter sur le sempiternel pied de biche providentiel (mais qu'on trouve intelligent de virer de notre inventaire après un usage unique), à devoir rendre un petit service dérisoire à un passant qui n'a pourtant rien d'autre chose à faire qu'à rester planté à nous attendre avant de nous permettre d'essayer de sauver le monde.
Et puis ce scénario qui n'est absolument pas exploité et qu'on oublie facilement très vite en cours de jeu tant l'héroïne et les pnj manquent de personnalité, de charisme et de profondeur.

Alors bon, je mets quand-même un pouce bleu parce que le titre n'a rien de totalement rédhibitoire et qu'il pourra convenir aux mordus du genre où à ceux qui voudraient faire toute la série depuis le début. Il faut compter moins de 4h pour terminer l'intégralité du jeu, chapitre bonus compris, sans aide. A prendre néanmoins en soldes à -70% ou en cas de bonne offre pour le bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977197768', 'num_games_owned': 3607, 'num_reviews': 459, 'playtime_forever': 816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1675850215}
review:
Chronique d'au delà est un hidden plus que moyen. Affublé d'une technique plus que perfectible montrant des scènes très moches et rempli d'objets... trop d'objets sans aucun sens entre eux. Il en est de même avec les pièces du manoir (un laboratoire, un temple, un autel, on a même droit à un quai au sous sol..) à trop en faire cela devient risible. 

L'affichage sur un grand écran n'arrangeant rien, les scènes d'objets sont vraiment moches et étant donné que la traduction n'a pas subit un "lifting" depuis sa parution autant dire que comprendre le texte et deviner ce que l'on cherche est un challenge rien que pour cela.

L'histoire le "nerf" du jeu ne vaut rien, personnellement je n'ai toujours pas compris cette histoire de démon sorti d'un portail mais qui y est encore... et j'ai refait le jeu une deuxième fois... au cas où. Et je confirme, il n'y a rien de logique dans l'histoire... du début à la fin et l'incorporation des puzzles en fait de même...

Non, il n'y a vraiment pas grand chose à garder... mal fait, mal traduit, mal construit il ne vaut rien d'autre que le plaisir de dépenser son argent pour rien...

author: {'steamid': '76561197972279378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1520198085}
review: This is an earlier release from Artifex and it unfortunately does show. I'll put my hand up to be a spell and/or grammar checker for any AM games if you'd like as there is too many easy typos to find, easier than identifying the plot in this game. On the achievements (which I love in any game on Steam), I really have an issue with a reward being given for using a hint 40 times in a game. I finished the game with not one hint yet I'll need to go back over the game to earn the 'finish the tutorial' hint and the 'used 40 hints' achievement. The Hidden Object games make it wayyyy too easy for players to find a way out these days and people really should get a challenge out of a game or why bother. For those of us who grew up with Jane Jensen's games will know what I mean. Anyways, I put this game in context: it's a very rough early AM game and there have been many more success stories that have come with more recent experiences. The positive in the game are the hidden object scenes are good, beyond that it's pretty standard fare. 5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198071375554', 'num_games_owned': 2813, 'num_reviews': 401, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1519756298}
review:
I have a love-hate relationship with this game. While the gameplay is good, graphics are nice, the story was very dull and bad, I got bored halfway through the game, and the worst part, it ended badly. I still don't know how to rate this game, it is not entirely bad, but some aspects will get you and leave you with a bad mood. 
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1315285611

First of all the voice overs, they are very limited and badly done. Most of the game has no voices, even the beginning of the bonus chapter was very quiet! No music, no one speaks and there are no sound effects too! 
The music was way too repetitive for my taste, and the journal was good and useful at times.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1315286337

Thankfully there is a fast traveling map since the game requires you to backtrack a lot to finish an objective. The hidden object scenes were very well done, I enjoyed this part of the game along with the mini-games, however, if you are after full achievements, you'll find this game VERY challenging due the timed achievements which require you to finish puzzles in less than 40 seconds and the other one in less than 70 second. I failed in both and in order to get those I have to restart the game all over again (Which I didn't do), instead I found a thread in the discussion area implying that people were trying to get those achievements, it was very frustrating because those puzzles are near the end of the game, you'll have to play the four hours gameplay to 'try your luck' with the puzzles. There is an alternative method which you can do is backing up your save file and keep on trying this puzzle until the achievement pops up. (Good luck)
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1315285136

Pros:
+OK Journal.
+Fast travel map.
+Graphics are good and the areas done nicely.
+Steam achievements. (You must read the guide section+Discussion, there are some timed achievements)
+Collectibles.

Cons:
-Limited voice overs.
-Not good story (Ended badly)
-Repetitive music.
-Average boring story.
-No replay value.

The bonus chapter was extra boring. I still don't know if I want to recommend this one or not. But I'll give it thumb sideways. Play it if you can ignore the story and enjoy the hidden object scenes which this game is full with. The puzzles were fun too if you don't care much about the achievements. This is the first game of the series, I hope they improved the next two games which are already out. Don't pay full price for this, and don't pick it up if this is your first hidden object game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011478984', 'num_games_owned': 2007, 'num_reviews': 217, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1519117240}
review: 这是通关的第48个steam游戏。其实大可以复制下牛头人的诅咒的评论，因为也没啥差距。自带中文是好事，机翻真是害死人。这游戏的单词找物特别多，感觉是一个接一个，有一个要找“蝙蝠”的，按了提示才发现，原来是“球棒”，都是bat就。。。 而且标题蛮好用恶魔猎人的，非用了个狩魔者。谜题设置也一般，跟AM本社开发的还是有差距。

author: {'steamid': '76561198047527390', 'num_games_owned': 10863, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1048, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1048, 'last_played': 1515578487}
review:
이야기의 진행이 좀 비약적이긴 하지만
괜찮게 짜여진 퍼즐간의 개연성과 그리 어렵지 않은 퍼즐 구성으로
1회차를 플레이 할때는 꽤 재미있게 하였다. 

한글 번역이 가끔 틀려서 숨은 그림찾기에서 당황스러운 부분이 있었고,
(지구본 globe를 장갑으로 번역 한다던가, 박쥐 bat을 방망이로 번역한다던가..)
한번 도전과제를 놓치면 게임을 처음부터 다시 해야해서
플레이타임중 10시간 가까이를 반복해서 해야했다.
(근래에 6회차까지 플레이한 게임이 처음인듯..)
다음 부터는 꼭 했던 퍼즐은 메뉴에서 찾아서 하게 해줬으면 좋겠다. 

그래도 늘 잊지 않고 한글화를 해주고
많은 퍼즐+히든 오브젝트 게임들 중에 나쁘지 않게 내주어 추천!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972117896', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1515479798}
review: I liked the game as well as the bonus game, but item names need to be correct for a hidden object game. Scorpio for Scorpion, Ecg for ECG/EKG, and one that I forget now, had an extra letter at the end and wasn't really spelled right.  The first one had me looking for an Astrological sign, the second should have all been upper case for an acronym. Small things but when the spelling on the intent misdirects you, then it is not as much fun. I expect higher quality for Artifex... I am recommending the game, but I was personally disappointed in the spelling errors.

author: {'steamid': '76561198185995181', 'num_games_owned': 1349, 'num_reviews': 900, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1514946048}
review:
和它的续作们相比，这款游戏就是渣渣！
游戏最出色的是画面，还算细致，过场动画也是一般般；
游戏剧情几乎没有，一团浆糊啥都没说清；
整个游戏几乎没几个谜题，满世界的找物找物！奖励关卡还不如不要，奖励关卡的谜题与本体大部分都重复了，毫无诚意；
这款游戏最令人发指的是它的音乐，对没错，是音乐！我简直无法相信我会因为一款解密游戏的音乐直接判了它死刑！但是我觉得无论是谁，经历过两个小时的单曲循环后还会对这破游戏有任何好心情！
总之，请大家直接玩续作！

author: {'steamid': '76561198017661158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1514682014}
review: I'd give this 3.5 or 4 out of 5.  It's very simple, suitable for children (although it might be a bit too scary for the littlest ones), but the puzzles can still be satisfying for an adult who is looking for 3 bucks worth of entertainment.  Getting 100% achievements can be a tricky challenge, but all of the achievements are timed and some of the failure conditions are a little too picky for my liking.  The story is pretty threadbare and not really worth mentioning.  I wouldn't pay more than 3 bucks but if you want to spend a coffee's worth of pocket change it's a decent couple hours of entertainment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027013569', 'num_games_owned': 890, 'num_reviews': 435, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1511644810}
review:
Je joue sur Linux. Version Linux : excellente.

[h1]Le jeu[/h1]

Les graphismes sont dans la moyenne pour un jeu d'objets cachés, la difficulté est correcte, ni trop facile ni trop difficile ! Aucune incohérence dans le récit, pas de trous dans l'histoire, ça s'enchaine bien, c'est cool.

Autant la plupart des jeux du genre ont quelques erreurs de traduction, autant là, c'est n'importe quoi. La version française est lamentable. Il manque des mots dans certaines phrases (on sent la traduction google...), les noms de certains objets sont en allemand, d'autres en italien. Certaines scènes vous obligeront à cliquer un peu au hasard pour un ou deux objets, c'est tout de même dommage (au total, peut-être une dizaine d'objets dans tout le jeu). Je n'ai pas testé en anglais, mais j'espère que c'est mieux !

[h1]Rejouabilité, achievements[/h1]

Terminer le jeu vous prendra environ 4h. J'ai recommencé 2x (finir le jeu quand on le connait prends environ 1h) pour les achievements que je n'avais pas, l'un d'eux ne s'étant pas déclenché la première fois... La partie bonus dure environ 30mins, quelques scènes supplémentaires qui font suite à l'histoire principale, c'est toujours bon à prendre.

[h1]En bref[/h1]

Bon, à part la traduction, le jeu est sympa, donc je recommande. Peut-être à jouer en anglais si la traduction est meilleure cela dit !

[h1]GNU/Linux[/h1]

La version Linux est excellente. Aucun soucis rencontré.

OS: Linux Mint 18.2 x64, MATE edition.
Hardware : i7 7700K OC@5Ghz, Nvidia 1080GTX, 32GB ram.
Screens : Triplescreen, dont un vertical, un seul screen X.

author: {'steamid': '76561198179018467', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1958, 'last_played': 1512746825}
review:
Si tratta di un gioco punta e clicca ad oggetti nascosti, senza infamia e senza lode.
Pro: carino il tutorial iniziale che guida passo passo nelle meccaniche di gioco (soprattutto se si è alle prime esperienze), utilissima la mappa per gli spostamenti rapidi e le indicazioni per gli enigmi.
Contro: Non è possibile resettare i minigiochi, nemmeno se esci e rientri nell'evento. Questo rende difficile l'ottenimento di alcuni achivment.

Consiglio di prenderlo solo se fortemente scontato.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076328268', 'num_games_owned': 1447, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1510866911}
review:
Czuć, że jest to jedna z pierwszych gier tego studia i stąd jest bardzo przeciętna. 

Fabuła beznadziejnie sztampowa i co gorsza mająca słabą narrację, przez co gra kompletnie nie wciąga. Mimo że krótka to chyba z cztery, pięć razy ją odpalałem, żeby ostatecznie ukończyć. 
Sceny z ukrytymi przedmiotami by obleciały, ale sytuacje gdy mam wskazać ptaka, a mam dwa ptaki, czy serwetę i przy tym dwie serwety, potrafią wkurzyć. Pomysł ze zmieniającymi się przedmiotami w tych scenach taki sobie.
Najbardziej zirytowały mnie achievementy. Wiadomo że takie gry dają szansę ich zrobienia, czasem nawet w 100% przy jednym podejściu. Tu teoretycznie też tak jest, ale są konkretne łamigłówki do zrobienia na czas, co przy pierwszym podejściu może być ekstremalnie trudne (mimo że w większości są oklepane i względnie proste), a wiedząc już jak je zrobić człowiek nie ma ochoty jeszcze raz przechodzić całej nudnej rozgrywki (ja to więc odpuściłem). Wśród nich było jedno bardzo łatwe – przeniesienie kulki w prostym labiryncie do celu (nawet nie tyle na czas, co należało to zrobić bez żadnego błędu), które bezproblemowo można byłoby zaliczyć za pierwszym razem, gdyby nie fatalne sterowanie, zrobione ewidentnie pod przeciąganie po ekranie czyli pod tablety, z myszką było to ciężkie, na czym też się wyłożyłem. Jeszcze mogę dodać, że jedno z osiągnięć nie chciało mi wskoczyć i dopiero w bonusowym epizodzie zaskoczyło (wskazanie trzech przedmiotów w ciągu kilku sekund w scenie z HO). W efekcie przy tych ułomnościach rozgrywki trochę frustracji we mnie narosło.

Co do oprawy audio-wizualnej to też nie jest do końca różowo. 
Muzyka jest nierówna. W paru momentach są nieco dziwne drażniące motywy, które sprowokowały mnie do wyciszenia jej całkowicie. W innych jest w porządku, ale przez to pierwsze i tak większość gry przeszedłem z wyłączoną muzyką. 
Z kolei jakość obrazków może i jest akceptowalna, ale czuć że jest nieświeża, więc jak ktoś zaczął grać w ten gatunek przygodówek od nowszych tytułów, to może nieco narzekać (że obrazy nie są dość ostre, czyste), lecz przyjmując pewną dozę tolerancji jest w miarę ok, tym bardziej że kilka miejscówek jest bardzo przyzwoitych (bodajże pod wodą, niektóre wnętrza domu).

Komu to polecić? Może mało wybrednym graczom dopiero zaczynających przygodę z gatunkiem HOPA? Chyba co najwyżej takim osobom, bo tym bardziej wymagającym Demon Hunter dobrej reklamy temu gatunkowi nie przyniesie. A całkiem doświadczeni w HOPAch gracze setnie się przy tej grze wynudzą i czasem poirytują różnymi wadami rozgrywki. Dlatego choć nie lubię dawać negatywów, to skoro jednak piszę komentarz, tu nie mogę zrobić inaczej.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055712561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1502651223}
review: Nouveau jeu d'objet caché, avec une histoire bateau, histoire de nous mettre dans le mood, hein... Une histoire de démons, de portails à activer ou désactiver et des personnages secondaires négligeables. Je trouve le tout assez mal écrit, peu "clair" dans le sens où je n'ai pas vraiment senti la quête de Dawn, son destin, ses interrogations... Malgré tout, le jeu est joli, avec certains beaux décors (sous l'océan, par exemple) et un très grand nombre de scènes d'objets cachés. Les énigmes sont moyennes, ni trop ni trop peu. Succès parfois peu instinctifs. Un très gros bémol pour la traduction, faite avec les pieds (j'ai eu pas mal de parties en allemand !) Et....... pour le fameux "diviseur de printemps", chercher un compas (celui de l'école.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198356141989', 'num_games_owned': 2521, 'num_reviews': 637, 'playtime_forever': 791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 661, 'last_played': 1510078665}
review:
I know, it's the third Demon Hunter game that I review, and I've always written extremely short reviews about these awesome games.
And for some reasons (related to epic discounts XD) I played them without an order: 2, 3 and 1 (this one).
I think there's literally little to say.
Point and click adventures at their best.
Great story, awesome artworks.
Full of puzzles of any kind.
Hints, if you're stuck.
Plots full of mystic themes, magic, riddles..
The Demon Hunter series to me has everything an adventure puzzle game should have, from the hidden objects to the logic thinking, from the great art and soundtracks to the intriguing plot in constant need of player's input. Fully single-player, of course, for the sociopath that I am.
I stress "adventure", since I adore even more minimalistic puzzles, logic puzzles, physic puzzles and so on, but they're games with tons of levels and with no plot. This is another genre!
What's the only downside?
The price.
10€, or 10$, are definitely too much. But really TOO much. This isn't the new Final Fantasy and not even your favourite FPS. It's great, but it's still a point and click puzzle adventure.
But this series is so so awesome that I'd suggest to anyone to play it from the beginning, when the games are on heavy sales, like 0 or 90% down.
It will be worthy, trust me!
Oh, the other downside is the translation but I don't even mention this point in my review 'cos I somehow started to play everything in American English in the early '90s and went on. 9 games out of 10, they can come from every developer you want, have horrible translations and this whole series (as I said also in the other reviews) is no expection. So, English. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198010560368', 'num_games_owned': 1183, 'num_reviews': 703, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1505815557}
review: Demon Hunter: Chronicles from Beyond - казуальная point&click игрушка, с очень простыми загадками. Готический сеттинг: таинственный замок, в котором творится невесть что.  Играем мы за девушку, которая пытается разобраться во всех этих загадочных событиях. Игра действительно чересчур простая, на каждом углу какие-то подсказки, возможность скипа головоломок. Видно, что игра в первую очередь ориентированна на игроков - девушек, не сильно знакомыми с видео-играми, их действительно подобное может развлечь. Остальных игра врядли заинтересует, можно смело пройти мимо.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139328230', 'num_games_owned': 2324, 'num_reviews': 260, 'playtime_forever': 327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1498917086}
review:
Well... The experience that was [i]Demon Hunter: Chronicles from Beyond[/i] yet again proved to me that I was spoiled by Artifex Mundi's personally developed treasures to a degree of not being able to enjoy anything mediocre. That's why I was delaying to complete this one. Sure, the game carries the Artifex Mundi label, but only as the publisher. The developer team here is Brave Giant LTD - a developer of no small standing in HOG genre. Still, being their first and oldest game in the market, this one is clumsily done to tell the least.

My narrative about the plot - which is really, really shallow and not surprising at all - will contain spoilers, so be warned. Our protagonist in the series is Dawn Ashford, adopted daughter of Professor Ashford, who decides to return to Iowa Island after the mysterious demise of the professor. According to tabloids, his assistant is missing and no one has been able to enter the mansion after the event. Weird enough, we encounter no one when we arrive the place, rather than our senile neighbor and the fisherman which inhabits the lighthouse. No police, no reporter, no investigators... As Dawn progresses to explore the premises, she manages find a way into the mansion through obscurely challenging and even surreal means, she meets the infamous assistant who tells her that they've accidentally opened a portal to a demonic realm. For one reason or the other, we keep aiding this shady assistant, even though he keeps appearing and disappearing before our very eyes in a puff of black smoke. I mean... Dawn must have been a bit dim witted. Not so really surprisingly, we end up aiding a random demon to open the portal permanently, then find a conveniently stored diary page that explains we are a member of a long lost sect of demon hunters, alongside the medallion that may defeat this evil! I mean, come on! This is the mother of plot dumps! After that, the mansion blows up and we are the only survivor as our blood deems us strong.

Phew, as you may see for yourself, this is a complete disappointment as a story. What about the display, you ask? Well, it most certainly is not the most breathtaking in the genre, but environment art is enough of a success to establish some sense of aesthetic, by huddling up all the clichés of the genre one after another: secret garden, haunted mansion, occult laboratory, underwater site... We have all here, one after the other. Characters, on the other hand, lack any kind of esthetic composure or personality. The voice acting is terrible, the CGs are plain funny and no one bothered for a lip synch animation.

The gameplay isn't among the most satisfying either. There is tremendous backtracking, which is somewhat eased up a bit thanks to quick transport option within the map. HOG scenes are a dark stock and not easy on the eyes. They always contain one or two morphing objects that you should keep an eye out for. Also, they are sadly overused, considering we visit each and every HOG scene twice, or even thrice in some parts to prolong the game. Some of the puzzles are challenging and enjoyable, but achievements tied to them are timed, so if you were to accidentally got out of a puzzle or reset one, you may say goodbye to the relevant achievement, or you gotta replay the game just for the sake of getting that one. This is simply cruel if you ask me.

If you'd like a decent HOG, pick something else. If you are an Artifex Mundi fan, pick something else also. Hard core HOG lover? Maybe you'd have a chance. Anything else to say about this title? Hmmm, I sincerely do not think so. Considering there are two other games in the franchise, I hope that I'll be getting a better experience from the following games compared to this one. Most other reviewers out there say that I won't, but here is hoping. Good day, and good gaming to you!

Please also check out Lady Storyteller's Curator page [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/ladystoryteller#curation]here[/url] - follow for regular updates on reviews for other games!

author: {'steamid': '76561198201883645', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 1655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 709, 'last_played': 1643287419}
review:
哎呀，写着写着评测就轮到这个了。狩魔者，这是我在steam上的第一款游戏。事情是这样的，当时玩了一年的lol了，闲来无事上windows商店看看，有点想买这个[spoiler]  没见过世面怪我咯 摊手 [/spoiler]，但是直接买不了，托了同学才知道来steam买的。 【当时还是美元结算的。。。】想来是2015年6月份。从此知道了steam这个平台，认识了奸商G胖。懵懂少年从此打开了新的次元壁。。。
      至于正经的评测内容，反正你只要知道这是点点点的找东西游戏就行。去年暑假已经出3了，不贵，本来这个强迫症早期想集齐1 2 3 来着，想想还是算了。不对胃口就不难为自己了。
      本来是不推荐的，但是有情怀加成嘛。好歹是领路人，算上苦劳就给个好评吧。[spoiler]  反正本身就是褒贬不一 23333
 [/spoiler]   
-----------------------------------------
闲着没事翻了下商店，怎么你出的清一色36啊。好像价格的确不高不低的样子。因缺思厅~

author: {'steamid': '76561198067063974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1495127442}
review:
Wow, I never expected to be this disappointed by an Artifex Mundi game. Or this irritated. I'm glad I grabbed this at a discounted price.

The story was totally random. I wasn't even exactly sure what was happening at first. Who am I? Who is that?  How is this connected? I was only slightly interested in it towards the end of the game.

I missed a hidden object achievement because some of my clicks weren't registered correctly or not registered at all. The hidden object scenes weren't awful, some of them seemed to be in a lower quality. Not that that's a big deal. The mini game achievements require you to solve them in the first try, which doesn't sound hard, but there's a chance you totally won't understand what you're being asked to do. So, if you screw up or click out, you miss your chance for that playthrough.

Maybe buy it when it's discounted...or look for a free key.

I don't even want to replay for the achievements I missed. Which, includes the tutorial achievement that I skipped. Not even that. I won't even go back for that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129760323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1494553166}
review:
le seul point négatif, c'est une traduction française qui est parfois approximative;
Ex : une bouteille d'eau chaude = une bouillotte
 une brosse = un pinceau
une flasque = une gourde
et des fautes d'orthographe dans les mini jeux comme une squellette, ça donne saulette.

Après, c'est une question de reflexe, chercher une objet se rapprochant du mot donné.

sinon j'adore l'histoire, et beau design. 
un petit plus : en bas à droite, on nous indique le nombre d'objets cachés dans les scènes, c'est plus facile

author: {'steamid': '76561198054469963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1493658249}
review:
The game doesn't always acknowledge your clicks. A pretty hefty sin in this genre.
Puzzles repeat and consist of overly simplistic "old favorites" that have been around long before computers and the telegraph.
These games don't usually excell in storytelling. I know. But the logic holes in this narrative are so severe no amount of willing suspension of disbelief can cover them. The theme set out by the title and main character's backstory I thought was criminally underutilized.

The aesthetic is pretty spot on and the voice-acting is  suitably camp though. The point-and-click parts have some amusing moon logic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093284518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1491443604}
review: 我從開始玩點擊遊戲到現在, 遇到的最利害的就是這個, 除了一兩個場景以外, 整體遊戲背景基本上和主線內容完全拉不上關係, 一堆場景跑來跑去, 但場景故事基本上和主線無關, 你說這個遊戲叫XX探案、XXX歷險記、XX之謎等等也完全可以, 只要其中一兩個場景改一改內容就可以了, 某些智力遊戲說明不足, 有時你都不知要怎麼樣做, 唯有不斷嘗試, 另外一些卻又極端簡單; 找東西那個情節不斷出現, 很傷眼睛, 還要加上一些變形物件, 以及不斷在每一個畫面收集物品, 基本上是在拖時間而已, 除非是點擊遊戲的極諯愛好者, 否則不建議

author: {'steamid': '76561198065749673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1685043806}
review:
Das Spiel ist nett. Ein relativ leichtes Wimmelbildspielchen. 
Bei dem Spiel gibt es jedoch leider ein Problem:
Gerade bei den Wimmelbildspielen kommt es häufiger vor, dass die Übersetzung englisch zu deutsch nicht so ganz stimmt. 
z.B. soll ich eine Fledermaus finden -> war jedoch der Baseballschläger gemeint. 
Mit dem englischen Begriff ist es klar, wie es dazu  gekommen ist, nur würde ich mir da dann zumindest wünschen, dass ich das Spiel auf englisch stellen kann. 
Das hat mich teilweise ziemlich frustriert.
Ich hab mir jetzt ziemlichen Kopf gemacht ob empfehlen oder nicht. Auf englisch würde ich es empfehlen, jedoch in der deutschen Variante bisher leider nicht. Gerade bei Wimmelbildspielchen finde ich es wichtig, dass die Übersetzungen stimmen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198317057292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 862, 'last_played': 1489236653}

author: {'steamid': '76561198017196792', 'num_games_owned': 3699, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1488550193}
review:
With a HOG from Artifex Mundi you expect something top notch and it’s almost there… But nope. The story is rather okay, the game have a Halloween theme:  it is all played during nighttime; it’s all very dark with some ghosts you’ll meet here and there.  The screens are beautiful but really blurry, the music quickly becomes annoying. The mini games are VERY easy, like 15 seconds for the hardest one. There’s also one mini game I completed with a couple of random clicks because I couldn’t understand how I was supposed to solve it.  Another mini game was repeated 3 times during the game, I guess they were fed up and out of inspiration. 
It’s too bad since the search screens are rather nicely set up, all having one morphing item and a Halloween scenery – tomb, crypt, asylum etc. You also meet a couple of characters, all having errands for you – you kinda wonder how long they’ve been there waiting for you, starving and freezing in the middle of the night haha. The first part was fun, wandering on an island searching for items. 
However the game becomes really bland, uninspired and too classic once you enter the manor where the zones are small, linear, felt empty and more importantly the rooms didn’t have any coherence in their continuity. i.e. you have a classical Edgar Poe style room supposed to be a lab, which is followed by a… Rather modern hospital room. Followed by a full medieval throne room!... Which also contains an Indian statue of some elephant god (I bet you didn’t guess this one, eh?). All that followed by a rooftop with a gothic gargoyle! The rooms feels randomly slapped together, they probably pasted some leftovers graphics and sceneries from other games… It totally breaks the immersion. I got annoyed by all that and rushed to the end of the game. The bonus chapter was a bit better but was really short. The whole game barely lasted 5 hours, which is a bit short.
I do not recommend the game, it feels lackluster and unpolished. There’s way far better HOGs out there, don’t waste your time with this one.
