author: {'steamid': '76561198154405111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1488202855}
review: Ich hatte von diesem Hersteller schon "Philosophers Stone" gespielt, das mir sehr gut gefallen hat und las Demon Hunter ermäßigt war, habe ich es mir daher gekauft. Es ist aber längst nicht so toll wie das erste aus diesem Haus. Es herrscht ständig eine düstere Athmospähre, sogar die monotone Musik nervt irgendwann. Die Steuerung der Minispiele ist teilweise sehr unsauber, so daß man beim Mischen von Flüssigkeiten ständig angezeigt bekomt, dass das falsch ist obwohl es richtig sein sollte und man nur durch dauerndes Anklicken, die gewünschten Aktionen bekommt. Ausserdem ist die Übersetzung ins Deutsche bei den Minispielen manchmal so schlecht, dass man die Anweisung nicht verstehen kann. Gut, dass es reduziert war, mehr hätte ich auch dafür nicht ausgegeben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066945171', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1486749954}
review:
This game is, unfortunately, not up to par with what can be expected from Artifex Mundi, even if it is only published by them and not actually of their design.

The story is full of holes, some conclusions require spectacular leaps of logic and having to refer back to the diary constantly when you actually want to follow said leaps gets tiresome really quick. The puzzles are fairly standard.

Additionally, when last I fired up this game it had, apparently, gotten a German localization, and since my machine's language setting is German it switched the language. The translation is... not great. I would have much preferred to be able to select the language for myself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013070116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1506803192}
review:
One of the worse HOGs from Artifex.

- problems with registering clicks - infuriating when the game has achievements that want you to do multiple hidden object puzzles without a single misclick
- multiple situations when the character bypasses objects she's looking for lying in plain sight only to come back to them later with absolutely no reason
- bland story in general
- translation errors/untranslated cognates that should've been caught by a simple spellcheck
- achievements that require you to do puzzles on the first try, without testing. Misclicked because you didn't know the puzzle controls? Tough luck, start a new save to retry.

4/10, worth a game if you're bored and got this in a bundle, not worth otherwise.

Also, don't pay actual money for this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017967750', 'num_games_owned': 1537, 'num_reviews': 1327, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1482409627}
review:
[h1][b]Beyond[/b] average... I wanted this game to end very quick...[/h1]
I will focus on some main parts:
- music loop is very annoying and not fitting game's theme
- senseless name of the game... and I guess it was only made to create game series...
- some hidden object scenes were bad
- about 2 hours of gameplay + 0,5h with bonus chapter (meaning play time is shorter than card drop...)
- typical puzzles, just changed their visuals :( (you could exclude "telescope search" and "weather change puzzle")

+ generally fine backgrounds

author: {'steamid': '76561198120567690', 'num_games_owned': 940, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1482223726}
review:
Against my better judgement after my not so great experience with Demon Hunter 2: New Chapter, I gave Demon Hunter: Chronicles from Beyond a try. At first it appeared to be a good idea, but when looking back at it after playing through the whole game it left a bitter taste.

In this hidden object game, we take the role of a young woman who returns to Iowa island, a place where we were raised by Professor Ashmore, our foster father. The professor died during an experiment where he and his assistant tried to open a portal to another dimension. Of course it is up to us to find how this had happened.

The first thing we'll see when we start the game is the dull looking graphics which may seem to be in contrast with the vivid and beautiful art work of recently released hidden object games. On the other hand it has style and perfectly captivates the dark atmosphere, which - along with the core of the plot - is taken from the movie 'From Beyond' (the movie is pretty terrible in case you are wondering).

Partly because of the story and the atmosphere, the first half of the game is pleasant and fun to play with. There's a decent amount of suspense, lots of puzzles and interesting locations. We get to stroll around the island visiting the gardens, a lighthouse, a shack and a crane, all full of intriguing puzzles. The problems - the tediousness, the degradation of puzzles into almost endless waves of hidden object scenes - begin when we enter the house itself. We still get to solve some pretty tough puzzles, but mainly we'll chase necessary items through plenty of overused hidden object scenes. I do know that hiddden object games got their names from these scenes, but we all love more complex adventure elements, puzzles and minigames better, which actually require a bit of thinking, instead of looking for randomly appearing hidden object scenes. The morphing/transforming objects are also present here (just like in the sequel), but I really found these more tiresome than fun. The dullish graphics doesn't help spotting some of the items either. For achievements we can collect certain items (1 at each locations): leaves, coins, flasks and brooches, plus there are some timed puzzles (had to replay the game twice for the one where we have to paint some stone eyes towards the end).

There are some plotholes as well: why aren't there any police officers/crime scene investigators around the house, why hasn't the assistant been taken into custody? Why do we have to follow him blindly, after he vanishes into thin air several times? Also there's a part where we have to release (!) a shark into the water, to get rid of a mysterious underwater beast, after which we can safely (!!) dive and explore the bottom of the sea...

There's a bonus chapter in which we have to wake up from a nightmare, set after the main story, but there's nothing here really: it's super boring but at least also short (even though quick travel doesn't work here apparently). As for more problems many people mentioned that the lips of the characters don't move during cutscenes, but personally this annoyed me the least.

To sum it all up the game was a disappointment, which is a shame, because it starts out good and there are some quite hard and tricky puzzles in it, but the overuse of hidden object scenes meant to prolong the length of gameplay ruins the experience as a whole. It can be called fair, but unfortunately not good enough to be recommendable.

PROS
+ interesting premise
+ some good puzzles and minigames
+ first half of the game is enjoyable

CONS
- overuse of hidden object scenes
- some crazy elements in the story
- graphics is not so great
- disappointing and thus unnecessary bonus chapter

RATING
4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198001395593', 'num_games_owned': 1732, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1481659223}

Si vous jouez en français, je ne vous recommande pas ce jeu : la traduction est digne des systèmes automatiques d'il y a dix ans rendant l'histoire pénible à suivre et surtout certains hidden objects impossibles à faire sans laisser parler le hasard (allez trouver un linear ou encore un presse à marquetterie ...)

Très décevant pour cet éditeur qui nous a habitué à beaucoup mieux.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098765263', 'num_games_owned': 819, 'num_reviews': 246, 'playtime_forever': 1068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1068, 'last_played': 1479886808}
review:
Я люблю игры такого жанра, и надо сказать, что эта игра не так уж плоха, как некоторые пишут. Сюжет, конечно, хромает – злодей немного туповат… Музыка простая и незатейливая. Надо отметить много хороших головоломок, над которыми действительно приходится поразмыслить. Качественно прорисованные сцены поиска предметов. Возможность быстро перемещаться по карте очень радует.
К минусам этой игры могу отнести получение достижения «Алхимик» - приходится проходить игру несколько раз (чуть не туда нажал и опять приходится проходить игру сначала).
Относительно недорогая цена, пару вечеров и у вас есть 100%-я игра плюс вы получите карточки. 
Рекомендую
8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198028216179', 'num_games_owned': 2423, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 787, 'last_played': 1479280507}
review:
On the surface, [i]Demon Hunter: Chronicles from Beyond[/i] looks like a very exciting game. The title mentions a demon hunter so perhaps this game is filled with action and lots of supernatural excitement. Unfortunately, that’s not what you get with this game. While it’s a functioning hidden object game that will keep your brain working everything else about the title falls short. If you’re considering this game make sure it’s on sale or in a bundle because it isn’t a bad play through. What is lacks in story and graphics, it makes up with by having fun hidden object scenes and puzzles.


The story is one of the weakest parts of this title. You play a woman named Dawn, who returns to the island where she was raised, after the death of her guardian Prof. Ashmore... And that’s about all of the story you get. There are some sprinkles here and there and at the end you find a book which in one lump of text explains Dawn’s heritage but for most of the game you could be playing a random plumper named Joe and nothing would change. The main character has no personality, rarely speaks, and despite the title promising demon hunting there isn’t much of that. The main bad guy is a demon, who you’re not even hunting but come upon by chance and then you win. If you’re expecting the bonus chapter to shed any further light on things don’t hold your breath, it adds nothing. In the bonus chapter Dawn is in a coma caused by a demon and she has to fight to awaken herself. The best way I can describe this story is bland. It’s very bland.


What makes the game worth owning is the gameplay. If you’re a fan of hidden object games then you’ll be content with this title. It has quite a few scenes, though most you have to visit twice, and mixed in with the scenes are morphing objects to add a bit of challenge. There are also plenty of mini games of varying difficulties. What I disliked about these, however, is that some are directly tied to Steam achievements so if you mess up you don’t get the achievement. If you’re not worried about that or playing the game on a different platform then you’re fine. The game has a helpful map that shows points of interest as well as lets you teleport around. You are also given the choice of two levels of difficulty to play.


The graphics in the game are decent. The backgrounds are well done as are all of the hidden object scenes. Where the game falls short are the character’s themselves. Most seem lifeless and at times it feels like different artist did different characters making things a bit inconsistent. Also, the character animations are pretty bad, very stiff. The audio is sadly not much better. The background music is repetitive and the voice acting is horrible. Dawn thankfully doesn’t speak much, something I usually dislike but in this case I was alright with because her voice actress was just not very good. On the plus side, the sound effects aren’t so bad at least.


[i]Demon Hunter: Chronicles from Beyond[/i] isn’t the best hidden object game on the market, in fact it’s far from it. While I have played worst, I was expecting more from this title so I was left disappointed with the end result. If demon hunter is in the title of the game then I expect to go demon hunting. As I mentioned before, if you get it from a bundle or it’s on a good sale then go for it, it’s a good hidden object experience purely from a gameplay perspective. It also has Steam trading cards and achievements to collect if those tickle your fancy. If you’re in the market for a more well rounded game in this genre, however, keep looking.

[h1]Usagi’s Rating[/h1]


[list]
[*]Must buy.
[*]A good game to buy.
[*]Only buy if on sale.
[*][b]Mediocre.[/b]
[*]Avoid at all costs.
[/list]

[url=http://lunarproduction.com/]Lunar Productions[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198321395764', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1477020004}
review:
一款自带简中的解谜游戏。
怎么说呢，场景是比较丰富的。基本上每个场景都有收集的东西，[spoiler]但是收集东西也太简单了吧！	[/spoiler]
而且每到了新的重要剧情，你的东西就会全部清空，游戏基本上是一个节点一个节点进行的。
游戏比较多的偏向于找物，几乎所有重要的东西都是找找找出来的ˊ_>ˋ找物也是浅显的，基本上一找就一大片，不过有些东西没有接触过或是不了解真正名称而找不到。我是真的不知道原来弯脚规竟然找的是游标卡尺？！翻译有一定的问题。不过还好。
另外，游戏里面的小游戏简直简单到了一个迷的地步，随便玩玩ˊ_>ˋ
该游戏有着解谜游戏的通病——经常把物品放在奇奇怪怪的地方，[spoiler]比如说，把电池锁在笼子里[/spoiler]
游戏还是比较消磨时间的，无聊时候可以玩一玩。
找物游戏里面夹带着一点剧情。

author: {'steamid': '76561198001572563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1476125286}
review:
Das schlechteste Artifex Mundi Spiel das ich bisher hatte! Das Spiel bietet teilweise grauenhafte Soundeffekte, Übersetzungsfehler und bescheuerte Achievementbedingungen. Das man 3 Wimmelbilder hintereinander schaffen muss ohne Tipp und Fehlklick hört sich ja nicht schwer an, ABER wenn man dann die Übersetzungsfehler hinzugibt und dann noch die Tatsache dass bei sehr vielen Wimmelbilder das gesuchte Objetk mehrfach  vorhanden ist, z.B. des öfteren sind 3 Flaschen da und eine ist die richtige, ist das schon extrem nervig!

Ich bin eigentlich grßer Fan solcher Spiele aber das hier kann ich leider niemanden empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198283482125', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1473593544}
review:
J'ai joué à plusieurs jeux de cet éditeur et celui-ci est très mauvais.
L'intrigue, bien qu'ultra classique pourrait être intéressante, mais très mal exploitée. Un démon se manifeste à quasiment chaque écran et il n'y a aucune réaction de l'héroïne, pas un seul commentaire, rien.
Les énigmes ne sont pas spécialement difficiles, mais on trouve des objets à des endroits complètement improbables.
Rajoutons à ça que la traduction en français est vraiment horrible. Digne du premier site de traduction venu. Et encore quand certains mots sont traduits en français. J'ai vu passer plusieurs mots en italien. Et comme si ça ne suffisait pas, il y a des fautes d'orthographe et des fautes de frappe.
Fuyez ce jeu !
Je n'ai même pas eu envie de faire l'histoire annexe...

author: {'steamid': '76561198167958424', 'num_games_owned': 1193, 'num_reviews': 526, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1473456837}
review: Мне нравится и графика и формат игры, если не сильно вдумыватся в сюжет)))) он конечно слабоват.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116528583', 'num_games_owned': 2179, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1473259026}
review:
Eviterò di dilungarmi su cosa sia un Hidden Object Game, probabilmente li conoscete meglio di me.
Artifex Mundi è una garanzia sugli HOB però stavolta non mi ha convinto tanto quanto altri suoi titoli. Al di là delle parti di gioco de "trova l'oggetto" che mi sono sembrate piuttosto facili, il gioco ha un difetto che mi ha infastidito parecchio. Il tempo per risolvere gli enigmi è troppo poco! Per carità, nessun enigma impossibile, ma il tempo a disposizione (suppongo serva per gli achievement) è limitatissimo e non si ferma nemmeno quando leggete gli indizi. So che ai fini del gioco non cambia nulla, ma mi ha fatto mettere in discussione più volte la mia intelligenza ahahah
Al di là di questo tutto nella norma, il gioco non brilla ma non è nemmeno noioso.

Riassumendo uno dei tanti HOB in circolazione, mediocre comunque.
VOTO: 6.5

author: {'steamid': '76561198041507732', 'num_games_owned': 1025, 'num_reviews': 297, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1472523834}
review:
Мне игра понравилась не смотря на то что "зло" тут слишком глупое, итог в игр этого жанра ясен итак, а вот професс к победе тут был не менее интересным, чем в других играх данного жанра.
Как по мне - самые главные минусы этой игры - не лучшим образом насторены головомки "лабиринт" и "алхимик" обе пришлось перепроходить по нескольку раз, Лабиринт - потому, что стоит слегка отклониться курсору - он сбиваеться и это засчитывают как ошибку, а в алхимике случайно получаеться выйти из головоломки в процессе приготовления красителя, очень хотелось-бы исправления...

author: {'steamid': '76561197964149687', 'num_games_owned': 749, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1472403485}
review:
[h1]Summary:[/h1]
I will start the review in stating that while I am a reasonably seasoned veteran when it comes to point and click adventure games, this is the first title I have played from Artifex Mundi and one that is heavily focused on hidden object games.  The hidden object games were engrossing, and being an early game from the publisher you can see that they had some good ideas that they tried to execute upon.  Even with this said I couldn't recommend playing this game for the $9.99 normal price, and even still not at the deeply decreased price of a game bundle.  I'll be checking out several more titles from the publisher, but would only recommend going back to this game once you have a few of their other games under your belt so you can see the progression of their releases.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[list][*]While there is a simple design to the inventory, journal and map UI elements are easy to use and understand.  If there was any slight critique it would be that they could scale the UI % down a bit for more screen visibility, but otherwise on-point.
[*]The hidden object games are honestly what kept my head into the game until the end.  While sometimes their hiding decisions could be slightly tedious, overall this is what kept me going.  I won't place this in the con category, but one of the dynamics is that certain items will phase into a different item for a certain amount of time, making you keep an eye on those objects and click them when they are the object you need from your list.  Honestly, as I move onto their other titles I hope they just scrap this idea.  Just stick to well hidden items and you have a great element here.
[*]The title had enough and at the same time not too much content. You will probably find yourself finishing the game.  Despite a negative review it was able to keep somewhat cohesive in gameplay.[/list]



[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[list][*]While I can say that I reasonably enjoyed the art content to the game, there were some seriously lacking decisions from the art design team.  Not knowing who or what the art team is comprised of, the game feels like there were a few artists with different artistic styles.  The NPC characters had different art styles from one another for the most part, and destroyed any sense of environment they were going for; if there were multiple artists on the team, one person should have been dedicated to the characters if styles varied so much.  Further, if this was created by one artist, then I fear that some of the art may have been Photoshop magic sourced from real-world material, being that there is such a variance in presentation.  
[*]The story.  Honestly by this point, I don't want to give spoilers...but at the same time my brain is already starting to forget.  Not a lot of cohesiveness or purpose around the characters or the actions you take.
[*]Not a huge con, but I was frustrated that puzzles would begin their timer immediately without providing you any information on what you were trying to solve.  You could click a red question mark on the bottom right to read the objective, but by this point the clock is already running.  Why not present the objective before the clock starts?[/list]


[i]If you liked this review or want to see more recommended games, be sure to follow our curator group: [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Original_Curators_Group#curation]Follow Original Curator Group[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198031491767', 'num_games_owned': 482, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1472400214}
review:
This one was interesting enough. It felt like it was more of a challenge. The HOGS were well done in that some things were difficult to spot. The collectibles did not appear to be missable because you could return to all rooms until the end.  

The bonus content was a bit silly and not important. It took less than an hour. The fast travel didn't seem to work in it. But it was short enough not to be a huge bother.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052965201', 'num_games_owned': 1046, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1526574221}
review:
Game Mechanics:
The game consists almost solely of logic puzzles and hidden-object-scenes, though they are relatively well-designed they use, what is in my opinion, the single most unnecessary and time-consuming tactic ever: morphing objects. These objects morph between more than one form, meaning you will have to wait to cross the item off your list if you missed and just plain making them unnecessarily hard to find in the first place.

Plot:
The plot is pretty decent, though strives to be more epic and exciting than the mechanics of this game allow. The presure of time just doesn't feel as strict when you're lazily looking for irrelevant objects in someone else's mess.

Presentation:
The artwork isn't all that bad, but it feels kind of raw in places and could've used a bit more polish. The design in and of itself for both the areas and the hidden-object-scenes is pretty well done, if a little rough and the music is relatively atmospheric (but again doesn't really amplify the sense of urgency).

Completion:
If you've got this one, it's a pretty easy one to complete, just do it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970710846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 654, 'last_played': 1473114904}
review:
Bonjour a tous,

Concernant Demon Hunter: Chronicles from Beyond,

Malgres une mauvaise traduction qui rend les SOC un peut plus difficile le jeu en lui meme n'est pas mauvais.

Les enigmes sont sympas, mais sans grandes difficultés, l'histoire elle est classique rien d'extraordinaire.

Graphiquement parlant ca passe mais on vu mieux chez Artifex, coté son rien a dire les musiques collent bien a l'ambiance et les bruitages sont bons.

Demon Hunter: Chronicles from Beyond n'est pas le meilleur de la collection Artifex qui nous a habitué a mieux que ca je l'accorde, mais ce n'est pas le pire non plus.

Je le recommanderais seulement au fans de la collection pas pour ceux qui veulent connaitre le domaine des JOC.

Malgres ca on a vu bien pire, donc je met quand meme un pouce bleu, mais il est clair qu'il y a beaucoup mieux dans la collection Artifex.

Sur ce bon jeu a tous ;D

author: {'steamid': '76561198206383125', 'num_games_owned': 446, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1470082036}
review:
Let's start off with that while I reccomend this game, it would not be on top of the HOD recs list.

The story of Demon Hunter: Chronicles from Beyond is odd, not very intriguing and the art style while still pretty seems to be lacking. The translations are off here and there but that did not bother me much, what did bother me was the repetative (sp?) background music. The sound design of this game was really poor.

The bonus chapter was amusing, not spectacular but amusing. I liked the wacky art direction they chose for this part of the game. The rest eeehhhhhhh...
6.5/10 but still amusing enough to play if you got it in a bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017977574', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1469737011}
review: Carino e illogico come molti giochi di questo genere. Illogico poiché come spesso accade alcuni oggetti vengono trovati in posti illogici per la prosecuzione. Ma il vero difetto sta nella traduzione in italiano di alcuni elementi nelle schermate hidden object che ho finito cliccando a caso (un ago era una siringa per fare uno dei tanti esempi). Tuttavia rimane un giochino leggero, con avventura bonus finale e se lo trovate in sconto, perché no?

author: {'steamid': '76561198047077968', 'num_games_owned': 2010, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 987, 'last_played': 1469582758}
review:
Não é um jogo ruim mas apresenta alguns pontos negativos que podem frustrar o mais decidido dos jogadores. Vamos falar primeiro dos pontos positivos que são muitos. Cenários belíssimos como a grande maioria dos jogos dessa produtora, pintados a mão e de uma qualidade artística ímpar. Os jogos de objetos ocultos são bem balanceados e o sistema de dicas para os que curtem funciona muito bem, apesar que pode ser totalmente desnecessário para fãs hardcore desse tipo de jogo. A música é muito boa criando um clima de tensão adequado ao jogo. 
O enredo é um pouco fraco e infelizmente se confunde durante o decorrer do jogo, precisaria de mais informações ou cutscenes para amarrar bem a trama. Algumas vezes você vai estar fazendo uma determinada coisa sem saber ao certo o porquê de estar fazendo aquilo até chegar próximo do final do jogo pois o diário não te mandou fazer aquilo apesar de ser logicamente correto quando o evento acontecer. Isso é muito chato e frustrante.
Os puzzles são repetições de puzzles dessa mesma produtora sem nenhuma variação aparente, apenas mais do mesmo.
O que peca é a falta de lógica para encontrar alguns itens então tem que tentar, tentar e tentar até finalmente clicar no lugar certo, ainda bem que o cursor muda.
No mais dá pra se divertir um pouco mas é mais fraco que outros ótimos títulos da Artiflex como Nightmare from the Deep e Enigmatics, na minha opinião os melhores do gênero.
Nota ohadez: 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197971532357', 'num_games_owned': 2752, 'num_reviews': 413, 'playtime_forever': 680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 680, 'last_played': 1469360500}
review:
This game was one of the disappointing opus in Artifex Mundi's catalogue. I can feel clearly that it's not developed by them. Why was I let down this time by my favorite developer/publisher for casual adventure?

Dawn Ashmore was adopted by a professor when she was young. But when she learns of his death, she comes back to her hometown to investigate. Soon, she's discovering her origins - Dawn has red eyes...

The story is well-written up until you meet the evil behind everything... the game should have stopped there but the writers thought that it would be fun to let Ragnar (the evil entity) and the poor soul being possessed live a little more while you explore the rest of the mansion. Don't worry, they'll wait for you. So, they'll let you do everything in your power to destroy them. Clearly, it would have been better if the big revelation came at the real end, not at the 3/4 of the story.

The gameplay is quite standard: hidden objects scenes (with objects switching forms), puzzles, items to find and to use. However, while the puzzles are easy, the hidden objects scenes are quite a challenge... if you're not playing in English. When you're playing in another language, nothing is making sense. I mean, for French, you ends up with fischietto rosso or tagebuch or even bad translated words (for a compass to draw circle, which is compas in French, you ends up with diviseur de printemps... (spring divider)). And from what I gathered, it was worse in German as it was the story itself that was badly translated. Also some actions are boring.

The graphics are good, as the soundtrack, as it's very fitting to the story, though I didn't understand how you can end up with a Kraken suddenly.

Demon Hunter: Chronicles from Beyond wasn't reviewed before because I hoped that a language patch would be released. Apparently, nothing was done, which is surprising given the fact that they patched the other game that was worse than Demon Hunters in terms of translation, Princess Isabella: Rise of an Heir. If you except the language problem (I'm pretty sure that English was unaffected), Demon Hunters is still a pretty decent game. It's only for that that I'll put a thumb up but keep in mind to switch to another language if you don't want to end up to search the meaning of a word (or you do your own translation guide, like I did for the French version).

author: {'steamid': '76561198172454749', 'num_games_owned': 2937, 'num_reviews': 313, 'playtime_forever': 848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 846, 'last_played': 1478929019}
review:
[h1]게임의 퍼즐은 괜찮은데 스토리가 너무 짧아서 아쉬운 게임[/h1]

엔딩과 리뷰는 5월달에 이미 작성을 했지만 본작의 후속작이 당월 22일에 출시가 되는데다가 못 끝낸 도전과제를 모두 마무리하고 게임의 리뷰를 업데이트한다.
역시 Artifex Mundi사의 게임답게 그래픽은 상당히 멋지고 환상적이다.
판타지풍의 그림체가 정말 마음에 든다.

하지만, 이 게임이 스팀 평가란에 나와있는것처럼 생각보다 평점이 60%대로 낮은 이유는 막상 플레이를 해보고 내린 결론으로는 풀타임이 짧고 사실상 스토리가 너무 부실한게 흠인거같다. 스토리만 충실했다면 정말 좋은 게임이 되었을텐데 하는 아쉬움이 남는 게임이다.

게다가 이런 게임 최대의 약점이라고도 할수 있는 것이 아쉬운 결말이다.
퍼즐과 숨은그림찾기 게임이다보니까 스토리적으로 완성도 높은 결말을 이끌어내기가 어려울지도 모르겠다. 이 게임에 나오는 외계인 악당은 오래전에 TV에서 방영했던 독수리오형제에 나오는 악당 총통X를 방불케한다. 그런지 여주인공을 겁(?)만 주고 공격은 전혀 하지 못한다. 여주인공이 퍼즐을 풀고 몇가지 조작을 하니까 그냥 소멸되어버린다. 결말이 정말 싱급고 허무한 결말이고 늘 아쉬움을 주는 대목이다.

도전과제 중에는 시간 제약이 있는 도전과제가 몇개 있는데 그것들이 조금 달성하기가 쉽지 않은 편이다. 잘하시는 분들은 1회차로 도전과제를 완결할지도 모르겠지만 대부분은 최소 2회 이상은 플레이해야 모든 도전과제를 완료할수 있을 것이다.

도전과제와 관련해서 몇가지 적어본다.
다른 도전과제는 하다보면 그나마 쉬운편이므로 패스하고 조금 까다로운 도전과제 3가지와 튜토리얼과 관련한 것만 얘기할려고 한다.

퓨즈박스 미니 게임 1분 안해 완성하기
(Complete the Fuse Box mini game in under a minute)
https://youtu.be/yp_vCBLoFbk

70초 내로 돌을 금으로 만들기.
Conjure gold out of stone in 70 seconds.
https://youtu.be/TCjNOg4vbO0

미로 미니 게임을 실수 없이 완수하세요.
Complete the Labyrinth mini game without a mistake.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=725651293

퓨즈박스와 연금술 도전과제는 시간의 제약을 받기때문에 시간내에 끝내야 하는 퍼즐이다.
퓨즈 퍼즐은 처음 이 게임을 접하시는 유저에게 생각보다 안풀리는 퍼즐일것이다.
그래서 제시간 안에 끝내기란 쉬운게 아닌데 이것도 계속 연습(?)을 하다보면 풀리긴 마련이지만
도전과제를 언락하기 위해서 제시간 안에 완결을 지울려면 동영상을 참조하거나 가이드를 참고해서 순서를 익히는것도 좋은 방법이다.
연금술은 조금이라도 실수를 한다면 시간내에 끝내기가 사실상 어렵다.
시간을 타이트하게 딱 70초로 맞쳐놨기때문에 실수없이 머뭇꺼림없이 완료해야 한다.
미로 미니 게임의 경우는 길찾기가 문제가 아니다. 마우스를 때지않고 해야 하는 도전과제라서 어려운 것이다. 마우스 놀림이 능숙하다면 어려운 문제도 아니지만...쉬운것 같으면서도 막상하면 그렇지도 않은데, 마우스를 왼쪽버튼을 누른상태에서 시작해서 완료지점까지 연결해야 하는데 잘못해서 마우스에서 손을 때면 실패가 되는 퍼즐이다. 은근히 손에 힘이 들어가게 만드는 퍼즐이므로 조금 신경을 써야 한다.

그리고, 추가적으로 말하자면 튜토리얼을 완수하라는 퍼즐이 있는데, 만약 이 게임에 익숙하다고 시작부터 튜토리얼 건너뛰어버리면 엔딩을 본 후에 다시 플레이를 하게 되면 튜토리얼은 나오지 않는다. 그나마 다행스러운 것은 다른 게임과는 다르게 도전과제 중에 '모든 도전과제 완료하기'란 도전과제가 없으므로 만약 모르고 튜토리얼을 건너뛰어버렸다면 새로운 닉네임을 만들어서 시작할때 튜토리얼을 완료하면 도전과제는 모두 완료하는데 지장이 없다. 다시 말해서, 여러 닉네임을 만들어서 도전과제를 해도 모두 합산이 가능하므로 타게임과는 다른점이다.
(타게임의 경우 도전과제를 모두 완료할려면 자신이 플레이한 닉네임만으로 모든 도전과제를 언락해야 100% 완료가 가능한것과는 다르다는 말이다.)

이 게임은 아티펙스 먼디에서 직접 제작한 게임이 아닌데, 그래서인지 모르겠지만 이 게임을 만든 제작사에서 출시했던 히든 오브젝트게임들은 총 4개 정도가 있는데, 모두 플레이타임이 3시간이 체 안될 정도로 짧은 편이다. 그 점이 늘 아쉽고, 7월 22일에 나올 예정인 본 게임의 후속작 역시 플레이타임이 2~2시간 반정도로 짧은편이라고 할수 있다. 게다가 추가 스토리도 없는 것으로 예상되어서 그런 점에서는 유저한테 아쉬움을 주지 않을까 예상된다. 후속작도 이 게임과 마찬가지로 긍정의 평가가 70%를 넘기가 사실상 어려울 것으로 본다.

스토리가 짧은건 흠이지만 퍼즐 등이 재밌어서 세일 기간에 구입해서 플레이 해보시길 바란다.


평점은 전체적으로 잘 만들었음에도 스토리의 부재로 60점을 줄려고 한다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146645159', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 733, 'last_played': 1468130034}
review:
其实玩过一些点急解谜类游戏以后，我已经对这些游戏的剧情不那么关心了，剧情逻辑是否严谨、是否合理，都没有关系，我进去游戏的目标就是“找啊找”。

本作好像不是Artifex的“亲儿子”，画面不那么精致，不过也还说得过去，一般水平吧。物品翻译问题就不说了，老生常谈了。
最让我不能忍受的，就是游戏中对成就和谜题的判定。其实这种问题其他游戏也有，往往很令人不爽。
需要注意的是，其中成就“三分之三”是要求玩家[b]连续三次[/b]在无误点的情况下才能取得该成就，而成就列表里的中文说明并没有表达出这个意思，反正是把我给坑了，不得不进行三周目（还好只用寻物三次）。

但尽管我已经3周目了，还是没能做到全成就，这就要游戏的判定来背锅了= =
成就“小白鼠”要求玩家不失误通过迷宫谜题。其实这个谜题确实不难，难的是玩家在用鼠标过关时，游戏坑爹的判定，鼠标的画线总是因为不符合游戏唯一的迷宫行进线路而被抹除（好像偏一点都不行，太死板了），这就算失误一次了啊，这个游戏不能存盘啊，所以一定要一次成功啊！

其实我玩过的点击解密游戏里，关于判定的问题出过不少，但让我感到窝火的，这是第一次，因为我明明能比较轻松的获得成就，游戏就是不允许，你必须要按照他划给你的线来过迷宫。我擦！这还有什么游戏性可言呢！

还有就是关于解谜时间的判定问题，成就“炼金术士”要求70秒内完成谜题，但是我专门计时后发现，就算我在70s内完成，依然无法获得成就，这就很令我恼火了(╯‵□′)╯︵┻━┻

总的来说，本作各方面都比较一般，没有突出点，难度也不大，适合入门级玩家。如果可以的话，我想给中评。

author: {'steamid': '76561198067728231', 'num_games_owned': 535, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1461409325}
review:
Одна из многих среднячков из жанра hidden objects. Неплохой сюжет, качественно отрисованные сцены поиска предметов. Из минусов пожалуй только музыка по мне так неуместная, немного раздражает, в целом за такую сумму взять стоит.
Рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026806776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 302, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1467593624}
review:
By the standards of the Hidden Object genre, [i]Demon Hunter: Chronicles from Beyond[/i] is mediocre.  The story is the typical bilge, with the least-astonishing second-act twist I have ever encountered, there are some problems with the localization into English, and neither the HO scenes nor the minigames really stand out.  Artifex Mundi does some excellent HO games, but this wasn't one of them.

All that being said, however, unexceptional isn't the same thing as "bad."  Given how bad some Hidden Object games can be, [i]Chronicles from Beyond[/i] still falls within the bounds of tolerability.  There are better HO games out there, to be sure, but if you're running out of games, or if you catch a sale, this is still a very playable title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137502098', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 319, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1465827505}
review: Po raz pierwszy daję tej firmie negatywną ocenę. Wiem że sami jej nie wykonali (są wydawcą) ale zdecydowanie powinni sprawdzić pod czym się podpisują. Brak tu fabuły, muzyka nie współgra z tym co się dzieje na ekranie (denerwujący motyw muzyczny) i brak zakończenia. Słysząc pierwszy dialog o mało nie spadłam z krzesła - tak złego podłożenia głosów dawno nie słyszałam. A może słyszałam - na dworcu głównym gdzie mechaniczny głos krzyczał "zaraz przyjedzie pociąg z XYZ" :D Najbardziej boli mnie jednak tłumaczenie. Jest zrobione jakby od niechcenia. Każą szukać jednego gdy tak naprawdę trzeba kliknąć inną rzecz. W dodatku była zagadka gdzie trzeba było znaleźć karty- problem w tym, że na ekranie były DWIE paczki kart. Niby nic ale jeśli chce się dostać osiągnięcie to trochę lipa. A można było dopisać zieloną/niebieską paczkę kart :P Gra nie jest warta swojej ceny (prawie 10 Euro). Ja kupiłam moją wersję dużo taniej na Allegro, ale gdybym zapłaciła pełną cenę pewnie byłabym bardziej rozczarowana. Jeśli lubicie gry HOPA to radzę sprawdzić inne gry Artifex Mundi, bo Demon Hunter to po prostu strata czasu i nerwów. Tak wielka, że komunikat "odblokowano dodatkową przygodę" potraktowałam jako karę na nie nagrode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165920994', 'num_games_owned': 2451, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 746, 'last_played': 1465035536}
review:
Demon Hunter: Chronicles from Beyond is a HOG published by Artifex Mundi.

The Graphics are well drawn, the Sound... well, decided to play it without after a while.
The Storyidea itself is good, but there is only little Story while playing the Game, with only few Interactions with other Characters and some logical Flaws in the Game.
The HO-Scenes are solvable, but sadly have some Issues with the German Translation. The Game also has some Mini Games and 4 different Collectibles.
Some of the Achievements can not really be done in the first Try without a Guide, and since there is only Autosave you have to replay the whole Game to this Point again.

It is not really a bad Game, but the Potential the Story has was not used. If there was a neutral Option i would choose this.
If you like HOGs and you get it with a discount i can recommend it, but it is not my favorite Hidden Object Game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098400194', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 463, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1464882421}

author: {'steamid': '76561197979937358', 'num_games_owned': 4314, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 837, 'last_played': 1464052074}
review:
+ Cool puzzles (good difficulty)
+ Feels short/er
+ Ach.
------------------------------------
- Hard work for an achievement hunter: there are some missable TIME achievements. The big problem is, that all of those games are auto saved - that means, when you miss it, you have to play the WHOLE game to the puzzle/s again.( And the hardest one is right before the end..) So you CAN play it through with just 1 attempt, but that needs precise pre-work + help from guides!
- Bonus Chapter got no achievements

author: {'steamid': '76561197973059038', 'num_games_owned': 2548, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1463549277}
review:
[h1] TL:DR - Mediocre, but not unplayable [/h1]
Not what you'd expect from Artifex Mundi (Actually they are just publishing this one).
Plot is ... Is there a plot? Puzzles are on the easy side and feel recycled. HO scenes not bad, 
but not good and have an annoying feature.
Voice acting is quite bad and music turned all the way down.
I did finish it (4-5 hours) which means it isn't horrible. Just not good enough

[h1] Long version [/h1]
So, another game I would have wished for a slightly more Neutral option.
It's not horrible, is playable, just not good and there are definitely better options in the genre.

A good HO game has a few components so let's break it down:
* Plot - No plot to mention here. The "plot" jumps around from X to Y, without much sense.
You are in the forest, then in the house, suddenly you dive under the sea. WTH?
Not even a passable attempt at a plot.

* HO scenes - I like it when the scenes make sense and you see items in their sensible location (As per
where the scene is). Here? not bad. I did feel that the mouse clicking wasn't sensitive enough and sometimes
(Esp. when rushing the clock) you had to re-click.
An extremely annoying feature is an item that changes, and you actually need to press it when the right one
of two forms appear. The changes alone hint at the item, so why the heck is that a good feature??

* Puzzles - Easy and lukewarm. A few were kind of familiar from other places.

* Item collection - Again, if the point of the puzzle or HO is just to give an item, I get that. But there were so many
items with multiples that you had to collect that everything became so linear.

* Graphics - So-so. Definitely seen better in the genre.

* Voice acting and music - The music was OK then became so annoying i turned it off.
Voice acting - Bad. Nothing else to say about it.

Summary - when you combine it all, you get a reheated microwave meal that feels as if you've seen it before.
Not horrible, easy and casual. If you like the genre, and have nothing much better, give it a go.
If you are a completer - Go for it. I played it for two evening at a business trip, in one of which I dozed off at some point.
It was a long day, but doesn't happen often :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198238849744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1453996419}
review: This game had pretty good graphics and good hidden objects games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972822414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 412, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1462733731}
review: I'm not sure why this game is getting more mixed reviews compared to other similar hidden object games. It is not the greatest example of the genre but it provided everything I was expecting. The art work is good and there are simple enjoyable puzzles. The story is okay but it did get some bonus points in my mind though by summoning demons through a rip-off star gate. So there are safer bets if you are wanting to play a hidden object game but this one is still worth a play in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083097958', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 371, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1460959927}
review:
結論言うと面白いです。

内容はファンタジー絡みの探偵物と言ったところでしょうか？
週末に軽く楽しむ、短編や中篇程度の小説のように楽しむことができます。

総当りクリックのアドベンチャー・ゲームに特有の同じ場所を行ったり来たりして時間を費やされる事も、
ヒント機能が非常に充実しているのでテンポを崩さず物語に集中できます。
次の行き先やアクション、パズルにもヒントは適用されるのでまずストレスが溜まるということもないでしょう。
パズルについては面倒ならスキップまでできてしまいます。

興味があれば購入しても損は無いと思いますよ。

author: {'steamid': '76561198155838477', 'num_games_owned': 762, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1460646976}

author: {'steamid': '76561198062674571', 'num_games_owned': 5359, 'num_reviews': 214, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1460322625}
review:
Demon Hunter: Chronicles from Beyond to krótka gra przygodowo-logiczna sygnowana logiem znanego polskiego studia Artifex Mundi. Należy jednak zaznaczyć, że owe studio jest jedynie wydawcą tytułu, a za jego stworzenie odpowiedzialny jest serbski zespół Brave Giant. W grze wcielamy się w kobietę o imieniu Dawn Harlock. Bohaterka dowiadując się, iż jej były mentor został zabity w niewyjaśnionych okolicznościach, wyrusza na wyspę Iowa, aby bliżej przyjrzeć się tej sprawie. Wkrótce napotyka na ślad przerażających eksperymentów, wskutek których na świat wydostały się pradawne siły zła.

Chronicles from Beyond, jak praktycznie każda produkcja spod szyldu Artifex Mundi, reprezentuje gatunek casualowych gier HOPA, czyli Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure. Jest to więc przygodówka point'n'click, wzbogacona o liczne minigry logiczne oraz sekwencje polegające na odnajdywaniu na ekranie ukrytych przedmiotów. Dlaczego casualowa? Ponieważ prawie na każdym kroku gracz może skorzystać z podpowiedzi, a zagadki logiczne po pewnym czasie pominąć.

Jak gra prezentuje się na tle innych produkcji tego typu? Średnio. Wstęp fabularny brzmi nawet ciekawie, ale z rozwojem wydarzeń można odczuć zawód. Historię do przodu popychają głównie przerywniki filmowe. Jest ich mało, a do tego są krótkie i bardzo uproszczone. Sprawia to, że całość przypomina bardziej streszczenie, aniżeli pełnoprawną opowieść i po prostu nie wciąga. Nieco lepiej prezentuje się oprawa wizualna produkcji. Lokacje, przedmioty i postacie wyglądają ładnie i nadają grze przyjemny, lekko baśniowy klimat. Szkoda tylko, że ich animacje wyglądają jak pokaz slajdów.

Rozgrywkę można podzielić na trzy etapy. I niestety do każdego można się jakoś doczepić. Po pierwsze elementy przygodowe. Ogólnie są całkiem nieźle wykonane i logiczne. Ale nie zawsze. Chwilami wydają się być kompletnie bez sensu, jak chociażby wtedy, kiedy bohaterka wyławia z akwarium zabawkowe rybki zabawkową wędką. Nieważne, że zamiast szukać wszystkich elementów owej wędki i składać je w całość, mogłaby po prostu zamoczyć rękę i zabawkę wyciągnąć. Podobnie sprawa ma się z minigrami logicznymi. Większość z nich do dość typowe łamigłówki, jak chociażby puzzle, labirynt czy proste zagadki matematyczne. Ale kilka z nich sensu nie ma za grosz. Przykładowo w jednej musimy na tablicy napisać wzór twierdzenia Pitagorasa. Po co? Tego pewnie nie wiedzą sami twórcy. Ale gorsze jest to, że gracz zawsze musi się sam domyślać, na czym dana zagadka polega, bo instrukcji przy żadnej nie ma. Nawet najmniejszej. No i ostatnia kwestia, czyli sekwencje hidden object. Projekty scen dają radę. Wyglądają nieźle, choć poszczególne przedmioty trochę wyróżniają się na tle otoczenia. Poza tym sekwencje są powtarzalne. Wszystkie sceny przeszukujemy kilka razy, a do tego w większości z nic szukamy tych samych przedmiotów. Jednakże są one całkiem nieźle poukrywane i nie raz musiałem się trochę namęczyć, aby je wszystkie odnaleźć, co zaliczam na plus. Doczepić się jeszcze muszę do polskiej lokalizacji gry. Oprócz zjedzonych liter i znaków interpunkcyjnych, natknąłem się na kilka źle nazwanych przedmiotów podczas sekwencji hidden object, co było dość irytujące.

Podsumowując, Demon Hunter: Chronicles from Beyond to produkcja poprawna. Oferuje około trzech godzin standardowej dla gatunku rozgrywki i ładną oprawę wizualną, ale prawie nic poza tym. Dodatkowo niesmak powodują liczne niedociągnięcia. Choć wymieniłem więcej wad niż zalet produkcji, to nie uważam czasu przy niej spędzonego za stracony. Większość zagadek i pozostałych elementów rozgrywki jest w porządku i ogólnie gra się w ten tytuł nieźle. Nie mogę polecić Demon Hunter: Chronicles from Beyond każdemu, ale najwięksi fani gatunku, lubiący wszelakie łamigłówki i sekwencje hidden object mogą się tą grą zainteresować.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991391480', 'num_games_owned': 329, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1459902911}

author: {'steamid': '76561198194289627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1459545750}
review:
(i've played both the Steam and Android releases of Demon Hunter: Chronicles from Beyond, and this review applies to both.)

Like all Artifex Mundi releases, this game is graphically top-notch, with pleasing music and game-play targeting casual gamers. After having played some 6 of their titles, i can say that one thing sets this particular title apart from all others: almost every single HO scene uses at least one ambiguous term in their list of words. e.g., "bird" when there are _two_ distinct birds in the scene, "bulb" when there is both a lightbulb and a bulb of garlic, "necklace" when there are clearly two of them, and "hammer" when there are _three_ hammers in the scene. i.e., someone either didn't pay much attention during the HO scene design or someone set out specifically to annoy any OCD players. (i suspect it's the latter, given how prevelant this pattern is in the game (i've counted at least five scenes with this problem).) What does all that mean? It means that the chances of a hard-core player being able to achieve a misclick-free HOG experience is near zero.

It's a damned good thing i'm not OCD about this type of game. (OTOH, were it C code or software API documentation, i'd be flipping out _all over the place_, giving 37 different kinds of thumbs-down (thumb-downs?) and middle-fingers-up (middle-finger-ups?).)

That one point is my _only_ complaint with with this title. Yes, it's kitchy. Yes, it's casual. Yes, its lax use of ambiguous terms _will_ frustrate hard-core, OCD HOG players to no end. Nonetheless, it's a relaxing journey through yet another colorful Artifex Mundi environment, and i recommend it to any non-OCD players.


PS: once again a huge thanks to the developers for supporting Linux. Like all of Artifex's titles i've run on Steam, it runs flawlessly on my 64-bit Mint Linux 17.3 installation.

Post-completion notes:

- approximate play time of 5-5.5 hours (which seems about par for Artifex Mundi HOG titles). i started this on Android and moved over to Steam about halfway through, which deflated the total time reported by Steam.

- the ending felt somewhat anticlimactic to me.

- the three color-mixing puzzles made _absolutely no sense_ to me, neither the instructions nor the mechanics. i was forced to skip those.

- puzzles where turning a knob/wheel also moves a separate knob/wheel, screwing up any alignment made by prior rotation of that knob/wheel, just frustrate the hell out of me. Blood pressure shoots through the roof.

- the "item fades in and out" feature of a small subset of items in HO scenes is really rather annoying, as finding the item is less about finding it and more about stumbling upon it when it just happens to be in view.

- near the end the puzzles seemed to make less and less sense to me. e.g., where the mixing vials are hidden.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993276277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1458767204}
review: A decent hidden object game, although some of the solutions are obtuse, and there is one achievement that is annoying to unlock. If you love HO games and you can get it on the cheap, check it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014869658', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1458596714}
review:
Maybe get it on sale if you're really into hidden object games. Don't expect too much. Lots of bad English--misspellings, possible translation issues? Illogic past what's acceptable for the genre, like the poison gas another reviewer mentioned. Art is okay but nothing amazing, especially for Artifex Mundi-branded games, which tend to be quite lovely. Brave Giant seems to have just waved a hand and said, "meh, good enough." Hidden objects are sometimes easy to find simply because they stand out against the background art, like old cartoons where you knew something would move because it was drawn differently.

Worst offense: Multiple items in hidden object scenes that could respond to the keyword. E.g., "lion" wants you to click on the lion face, not the full-body lion art.

author: {'steamid': '76561198274991062', 'num_games_owned': 197, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1458355274}
review:
这游戏没看测评就买了，在玩这个游戏前我一直以为我这种智商一般找东西靠猜的，解密游戏应该都还行。直到我玩到这个游戏！！！烂！烂！烂！这游戏归结起来就是就是无尽的找东西！！！谜题是什么，能吃么！简单的跟什么一样，根本不用动脑！找东西就好好找吧，毕竟基本都在找东西！你特么还有时间一会儿这个一会儿那个！烦不烦！连官方中文都拯救不了的差评！
唯一的亮点就是番外的地图了，画风还不错。

author: {'steamid': '76561198067941726', 'num_games_owned': 889, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1490109127}
review:
Nie polecam.

- Fabula praktycznie nie istnieje,
- liczbe dialogow mozna policzyc na placach jednej reki,
- tragiczne podlozenie glosow pod postacie,
- glowna postac niczego nie komentuje, 
- razace bledy w tlumaczeniu (np kieliszek, ktory okazuje sie soczewka),
- podczas szukania obiektow, niektore przedmioty zamieniaja sie w inne i trzeba czekac az wroca do wlasciwego stanu,
- czasem podwojne przedmioty podczas szukania obiektow (znalazles slonce z listy? To super, ale chodzi o to drugie itp),


Bardzo lubie gry tego typu, ale ta jest wyjatkowo nie udana. Nic sie w niej nie dzieje, po prostu idziesz przed siebie i szukasz potrzebych rzeczy nie wiadomo po co, bo w grze nic nie wyjasniaja.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025823574', 'num_games_owned': 3339, 'num_reviews': 218, 'playtime_forever': 615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 615, 'last_played': 1458143423}
review:
TLDR Version: Play this game for the hidden object scenes as there are quite a few. If you want meaningful story, decent puzzles and animations, you're looking for it at a wrong place. The game has nothing worthwhile to offer besides the HOscenes.
Don't even think about getting it at full price - 1-2€ is still way too much for it, as the quality Mundi games would cost about the same. Do yourself a favour and get this only in bundles, or just buy a different one.


The game's main problem that it's exceptionally boring. I'm used to the hidden object ways of going to and fro with items only to get more items and to backtrack even more, but as the game's puzzles are absolutely not challenging, it really feels to be just as much of a busywork as it sounds. Items and the way you need to use them on your surroundings are absolutely random - you need bars to climb up to the top of the shelves? No problem, it's on the table in one of the hidden object scenes, just they (4 pieces) are smaller than a pen.  Or when you install the fan to remove the toxic gas BY going through the toxic gas because they ventillation shaft is on the other side.  Or you knowing that a certain flower can be cut only with an enhanced dagger, yet when you later (!) find the note about it you're surprised because you never heard about the flower.  All the developers should have done to add " I need something sharp to cut these" as description, as if I remember correctly there are no other bladed weapon you get in the meanwhile.  And to add insult to the injury, as the character enters to a new section, she takes notes for herself about what she needs to do to progress. But only in her diary, you need to open it every single time because seemingly the character - played by you - doesn't knwos that she should do, so you need to check you OWN NOTES about it.  This game came out in 2014 december, Artifex Mundi was already going strong (they are only publishers here, not devs) and on bigfishgames the hidden object games were rampant already. Yet the developers of this game are repeatedly made design mistakes that were working fine since years - like the diary / popup about goals one, and they still mess it up. Add the terrible cutscene animations, the lackluster plot ( Mr I Didn't Killed The Professor guy disappers with a puff of f****n black smoke after you spoke to him, seriously? And after it I should be surprised that he's serving the demon?) . . .  I don't know what the developers were thinking when making this game. They took the concept of demonhunting (so demon enemy, get 'em tiger!), they made pretty good hidden object scenes and then topped the whole thing with the easiest puzzles they could figure out, then done some animations during the last few days of the development. At least this is how it looks like. Basically everything else than the hidden object scenes are present in the game for the sake of being present without any additional quality, because without them it couldn't be called a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198251082338', 'num_games_owned': 1047, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1457423471}

author: {'steamid': '76561198020487283', 'num_games_owned': 5988, 'num_reviews': 1183, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1457249144}
review:
这一部的槽点略多
首先剧情，嗯。。。虽然这个公司喜欢各种神话剧情，但是这个剧情真的是有些。。。奇妙了
最后魔法师站在你面前面、看着主角到处搜刮，最后解决自己2333为什么他就不制止主角呢2333
什么恶魔啊，传送门啊出现了，感觉配上解密的背景显得好奇怪2333
其次解密的难度，不知道是不是我个人解密的习惯问题，我感觉后面的解密难度要比前面几个解得谜题要简单的多
寻找物品的小游戏感觉有点多，而且隐藏的简直深沉！还会有会变化的物品，要等待时间点击
而且收集物品没有小游戏支撑，感觉难度好高
毕竟是包里的喜+1，质量算中等吧，喜欢解密的玩家可以玩一玩，该系列第一次见到数独的谜题

author: {'steamid': '76561198011732090', 'num_games_owned': 5180, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1457025628}
review: Niezła gra z gatunku HOG, ale całą przyjemność z gry psuje złe tłumaczenie. To nie jest arcadowa strzelanka, gdzie błędne tłumaczenie nie przeszkadza w bezproblemowej rozgrywce. Tutaj każdy błąd powoduje duże utrudnienia w ukończeniu zagadek. Nie mogę nawet powiedzieć, że ktoś po tłumaczeniu sprawdził coś ponad literówki bo bym skłamał. Małą rybę nazwano rozgwiazdą(!), a klucz płaski kluczem fracuskim. Takich baboli jest więcej i kończy się nie szukając tego doskonale ukrytego przedmiotu, ale klikając wszystko bo diabli wiedzą czy naprawdę jest tam gdzieś schowana fajka czy po prostu tłumacz miał fantazję i trzeba szukać lokomotywy. Dodatkowo miałem problem z aczikiem za rozwiązanie zagadki, system wewnątrz gry przyznał mi odznaczenie za to zadanie, ale steam już nie.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027424772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 808, 'last_played': 1520553283}
review:
[b][u]Game Information[/u][/b]

“Demon Hunter: Chronicles from the Beyond” is a Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure game that was developed by Brave Giant Studio and published by Artifex Mundi.

“Chronicles from the Beyond” is the first episode of “Demon Hunter.”

[b][u]The Game Review[/u][/b]

Game Visuals

I want to mention that the visuals in the game are well done. The visuals can be adjusted in the game's option menu.

Game Audio

I want to mention that audio for the game is well done. Even though the audio is somewhat simplistic and repetitive. The audio can be adjusted in the game's option menu as well.

Gameplay

There are two different game difficulty modes to choose from: Regular and Expert.

The notebook keeps track of progression in the game. Such as story events and clues.

There is a interactive map in the game. It allows the player to fast travel between each location quickly without having the need to constantly backtrack. It also indicates that there are certain tasks that can be completed at certain locations within the game. The interactive map is automatically given at the start of the game.

There is no padlock feature that is available to lock the inventory panel in place to make it stationary. The inventory panel automatically comes stationary.

The hidden object scenes consist of the following: Traditional word lists. Some of these hidden object scenes may require a little or no interaction. Most of the hidden object scenes can be replayed in the game's extra feature section.

The puzzles are fairly easy to solve without having the need to skip any of them. Most of the puzzles can be replayed in the game's extra feature section as well.

There are four sets of collectibles in the game. They are scattered throughout the game for the player to find.

There are twenty-eight different achievements that can be unlocked from playing the game. Each of these achievements does come with some requirements that need to be completed before they can be unlocked.

Since this is a collector's edition, there is a bonus chapter, but it can be accessed only after the main story is completed.

Miscellaneous

There are extra features in the game: Bonus Chapter; Bonus Hidden Object Scenes; Bonus Puzzles; Wallpapers; Concept Art and Soundtracks. Most of these extra features can be accessed only after the entire game is completed.

There are six different trading cards to collect. Only three of those trading cards are given out by the game. There are several ways to get the rest of the trading cards: Purchased from the Steam's Community Market; Trade with friends; Booster Packs and its Booster Pack Creator.

Final thoughts: I have found the game enjoyable to a certain extent. The replay value for the game is low. I would recommend this game, but not at the game's full price value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099346456', 'num_games_owned': 546, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1455716131}
review:
自带中文的解密小游戏 对于+1的来说 这波不亏。
谜题都很好玩的 有比较难的什么一大堆灯泡 要点一个 周围几个颜色都会变 然后把所有灯都变成红色的题目
也有那种简单的走迷宫啊消消乐之类的题目 就算不喜欢的话 也可以等时间到了跳过
对于挂卡的来说 这种+1游戏也可以挂卡 这波不亏。+1的小伙伴喜欢解密类的可以试试哦~成就貌似也很好打 我玩了三个小时 第一次通关游戏  解锁12个成就~不过后面的成就不知道咋弄出来了！
仅供参考！

author: {'steamid': '76561198023666926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1772, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1450480416}
review:
Games from Artifex Mundi are good or very good, this one is definitely not bad either :)
Solid HOG game, very nice and detailed visuals, quite decent puzzles and fun gameplay. Story is also not bad

I don't have to high expectations when it comes to HOG games I like playing this type of games when my computer is rendering something or I waiting for client feedback and hog games and simple indie games are perfect for that, almost no resources are needed to play it and meantime I can do some heavy rendering and keep eye on progress on second screen while playing game :)
So almost any HOG game is perfect for me, it have to very bad to disappoint me and this one is very good :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198074744887', 'num_games_owned': 1511, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1451731974}
review:
Szó se róla, több ponton meglátszik, hogy nem készítő, csak kiadó az Artifex Mundi, de önmagában nézve jó kis játék ez, ha nem is teljes áron, egy klassz akcióban/bundléban határozottan ajánlható.
Aki már sok ilyennel játszott, annak újdonságot nem nagyon fog hozni, a rejtvények ugyanazok, mint bárhol máshol, kicsit talán rövidebb is, mint amit megszokott az ember. (A lényeg, hogy két ilyen játék között elég időt hagyjunk magunknak.  :-DD )

author: {'steamid': '76561198032800685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 190, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1451319870}
review: I don't like giving negative reviews to an Artifex Mundi game since their works are usually the best, but I would recommend this one only to Hidden Object Games' novices, not so much to expert players. The graphics are good and there's an extra chapter after the main story, but It's very easy even at expert difficulty and the story is weak compared to other Artifex Mundi titles. The only slightly difficult thing about this game is getting some achievements (like finishing certain puzzles at the first try), other than that I was very disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971341065', 'num_games_owned': 3377, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1451133530}
review:
Another competent hidden object game that is perfectly playable and easy to recommend as long as your expectations aren't too high.

Overall the story is decent enough but fairly predictable and sparse, and fairly random/illogical at times - for example the way of rescuing the clock hand from the fountain, or the way you use lightning and then immediately stand in the very recently electrified puddle while the storm continues to do a hidden object scene, etc.

The English translation has a number of mistakes, but luckily nothing that really affects gameplay much (cigarette bud confused me for a few seconds, and it took a while to get used to looking for a compass when asked for a divider, although I think in this case it is technically the correct term for the tool, but rarely called by this name at least in British English outside of specialist circles). The voice acting is fairly decent, although there isn't a whole lot of it - and mostly it is your protagonist narrating events in cut scenes.

In terms of gameplay the point and click sections are all okay, if prone to fairly random events happening, the puzzles are all okay but very easy, and the hidden object scenes are fine apart from the weird morphing thing where objects you need to collect turn into something else you can't click on for a short while. This can attract your attention to the movement on screen (but 50% of the time to something you can't collect) or make you think you have checked an area when you have actually missed it, I am not sure this really adds anything, it just sort of randomizes how difficult scenes are a bit. The standard map with teleport and pointers to where you can do stuff is included, which is always a plus especially in games where you jump around between locations over and over as you do here. 

The extra chapter in the collectors edition is pretty well done and atmospheric, although the puzzles are a bit repetitive (in the 7 or so rooms in it, you do the 7/5 capacity beaker thing you already did in the main game right at the end twice more for example), and given the amount of running back to the first room that happens later on it is annoying the map teleport is turned off for the bonus chapter.

review:

Voto 5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197998357047', 'num_games_owned': 986, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1445442430}
review:
Classica avventura casual di stampo misterioso/paranormale con semplici enigmi e scene hidden object.
Si lascia giocare con tranquillità e permette di trascorrere un paio d'ore  senza impazzire troppo per la difficoltà.
Segnalo alcuni gravi errori di traduzione che rendono talvolta indispensabile ricorrere all'aiuto per individuare oggetti il cui nome risulta sbagliato e fuorviante (esempio: la "mazza" era poi un "pipistrello", dal momento che entrambi in inglese si chiamano "bat").
Consigliabile se acquistato durante i saldi, non a prezzo pieno.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091297896', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1445176154}
review: HOG severler için kaçırılmaması gereken bir Artifex Mundi daha. Ses ve görüntü efektleri belirli bir standardın altına düşmüyor. Öykü en işte seviyesinde. Açıkçası daha önce herhangi bir Artifex Mundi oynadıysanız akışı aşağı yukarı tahmin edebiliyorsunuz. Hidden object sahneleri göz yormuyor, fakat 1-2 sahnede birbirine benzer 2-3 nesne var. Bu da biraz kafa karıştırıcı. Genel notum 7/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004587782', 'num_games_owned': 3459, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 807, 'last_played': 1445146361}
{'steamid': '76561198035785835', 'num_games_owned': 1369, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1460429336}
review:
This is another decent Artifex Mundi contribution to the genre and while it has many familiar aspects of an AM game, it's not the most stellar addition to their library.  However, despite some shaky plot (or lack thereof), it has all the HO and minigame love that fans of the genre will appreciate.

Sound and music is done well enough.  Nothing that stands out and nothing that's terrible.  Graphics look nice enough for the game type.  Animation is minimal but decent, especially the final scenes.  HO scenes are detailed but not challenging.  The game adds "morphing" objects that can only be clicked when the in correct form; this would be irritating except for the quite fast change time which means you won't have to wait more than a couple of seconds for it to flip back.  If you don't have the patience to wait five seconds, you may not like it.  I didn't mind.

My single grouch with the game is the lack of plot; there's some good setup, then a lot of not-much, until the very end when you get a chunk of information sort of tossed at your head.  But even that information is scanty, and not in a "you have to roll it around in your brain to make a conclusion" awesome way.  I'm hoping the bonus chapter has some more back story but it honestly should have been in the main game.

The game time isn't terribly long, so like most of these games, I recommend waiting for a sale.  It's running about two hours for the main game (I haven't done the bonus content yet).  With the short playtime and sketchy plot, I wouldn't get it full price.  But with a sale, I wouldn't hesitate to grab it.  It's a fun playthrough even with the plot issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102948932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 279, 'playtime_forever': 1232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 841, 'last_played': 1529130090}
review:
遊戯中に気になる個所が多くある。

①誤訳　　品捜しのときに角材を「棒」　絆創膏を「包帶」と表記。
②声優　　容姿と合致していない品がないへたくそな演戯
③表記　　濾過を「ろ過」　日本語翻訳した人は小學生？
④脚本　　冤罪の知人を救うの目的のはづなのにあの顛末はいったいなに？


他にも女詞をつかう男が登場するなど。　　　　　　

 驚愕の終幕なので錢をはらって遊ぶ價値があります。



しかし移動範圍が狭いので遊びやすく
（内容量も少ない）
映像はきらきらして美麗。その美点を數數の不具合が脚を拉っぱている。

author: {'steamid': '76561197989215538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1442996546}
review:
First thing to mention, As i don't think anyone else has said it, Jeffrey Combs (Re-Animator / The Frighteners), Is in this game, While the game (to me) is so far the worst i've played from Artifex mundi (even tho they worked togeather with someone else on this one), It was fun playing thru mostly due to that the "scientist assistant" you will be bumbpin' into now and then is Jeffrey Combs. (They've basicly taken him straight out of Re-Animator, n put him in this game), He's my favorite Mad scientist ever.

The music.. Isin't that great, But it does put you in the mood of going thru a creepy mansion, thingy.

There is alot of achivements compared to any other Artifex Mundi game, Altho i couldn't be bothred with most as you only get 1 shot in the game, and you've got a timelimit (replay the game to try again).

There is hint & skip buttons, So thats good. (as there are some very frustrateing puzzles).

Some puzzles demands you to be able to see colors (Not as userfriendly as the other A.M. Games.).

The mouse sensetivity feels really slow (Was like a chore to move the pointer around, At least for me).

To me, This might be the worst i've played from Artifex Mundi, But.. i'd still say 4 / 5, Becouse of Jeffrey Combs. (without him 2 / 5).

author: {'steamid': '76561198101802351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 376, 'last_played': 1435753433}
review:
[h1]Что делать, если демон-антагонист глуп, как пробка гугл поиск[/h1]

Обзоры на эту игру смешанные, поэтому приступая к ней я ничего особенного и не ждал. К своему удивлению я обнаружил, что игра довольна хороша (для жанра hidden objects): много хороших головоломок и сцен поиска предметов, при этом хорошо отрисованных; стандартный для игр этого жанра сюжет и, главное, возможность быстро перемещаться по карте, чего очень не хватает в старых играх издателя данного творения. Люди жалуются на две вещи: музыку и сюжет. Да, музыка тут немного странная, но я не могу сказать, что она меня раздражала, как некоторых. А что касается сюжета, то он тут не сильно лучше или хуже, чем у братьев по жанру, разве что антагонист тут поражает своей тупостью.

[i]Если любите игры подобного жарна, то смело берите данную игру и не бойтесь смешанных обзоров - не все так плохо. 6/10 [/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198052444935', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1437075565}

author: {'steamid': '76561198042831386', 'num_games_owned': 598, 'num_reviews': 627, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1433182020}
review:
[h1]Short version: 71%[/h1]
Demon Hunter is a beautiful hidden object game with almost no story or artistic direction. It’s far from the usual Artifex Mundi quality in many aspects, but it is still quite enjoyable– if you like casual level one-afternoon titles.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
Demon Hunter: Chronicles from Beyond is almost like a showcase Artifex Mundi game. It lacks an established theme, which, strangely, is used to its advantage. It revels in its blandness by using every type of clichéd scenery we have seen from this publisher: haunted mansion, lighthouse, underwater scenery, surrealistic nightmare world… everything is presented here.

Naturally the lack of plot (and the terrible voice-acting) means you have little investment in playing it apart from curiosity about what kind of visuals will the next place offer. And the game knows this, as it quickly pushes you forward. There are many hidden object scenes, but only a handful of quick puzzles beyond that. Therefore, it clocks out around 2-3 hours, making it one of the shortest games from this publisher, but still a more memorable one than most other hidden object games sold on Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972966291', 'num_games_owned': 5498, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1436386406}
review:
One of the original games by this developer and it shows.  It's not as crisp or animated as some of their more recent games, but as you progress through the story you begin to see where some of their ideas started and how far they've come.  

Still a good game and definitely worth playing through.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961725944', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1436303840}
review:
Ma recommandation négative ne veut pas dire que c'est un jeu pourri. C'est un jeu d'objets cachés tout ce qu'il y a de plus classique, ça passe le temps, c'est sympa pour les vacances, c'est pas super long. RAS de ce côté. Je ne le recommande pas à cause des erreurs de traduction. Ce n'est pas le premier jeu d'objets câchés à faire des erreurs, mais là, c'est un peu trop fréquent. J'ai eu droit à :

- Des noms d'objets en anglais non traduits (pas grâve si on est bon en anglais, mais c'est pas le cas de tout le monde, donc prévoir un dico)
- Des noms d'objets en allemand, mais aussi en Italien (idem que pour l'anglais)
- De mauvaises descriptions d'objets, soit des approximations, soit des descriptions qui n'ont rien à voir, et là c'est chiant, car il faut cliquer sur tout pour chopper l'objet, ou se servir de l'aide. C'est vraiment problématique dans ce type de jeu et ça m'est arrivé plus d'une fois.
- Des fautes d'orthographes qui ne gènent pas à la compréhension, mais qui montrent avec l'ensemble des points ci dessus que la traduction a été faite à l'arrache, et sans test derrière sur des francophones.

Au final, c'est vraiment la localisation qui fait que je ne le recommande pas. Jouez y donc en anglais pour gommer ces bugs. Ce sera parfait si vous êtes bons en anglais, ou si vous souhaitez enrichir votre vocabulaire (prévoir un dico où de quoi traduire dans ce cas).

author: {'steamid': '76561198103121751', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1435676156}
review:
玩到灯塔就玩不下去了，一路走过来 ，全是找东西的谜题，本人眼瞎每次到最后一个都找不到，而且藏的地方特别怪。有些谜题解出来了没有一点动画，比如那个骷髅，找到东西给ta，然后就得到了一个物品，什么事都没发生，说好的交易呢！而且女主还叫ta死骷髅，你知道ta死的，你不会直接拿呀，还要找个骨头给ta！

动画的走路方式就不吐槽了，肯定偷懒了！

对这部作品有点失望。题材是不错的，如果能重制是最好的（做梦。

还有那个老太太是真人还是画出来的！

最后对不起，给你个差评。

author: {'steamid': '76561198067401934', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1435416911}
review:
C'est dommage le jeu aurait pu être bien mais déjà que l'histoire n'est pas terrible, le jeu est criblé de fautes. la traduction en français c'est du gros foutage de gueule. En plus on se retrouve avec d'autres langues pendant la recherche d'objets .. ça passe de l'anglais à l'Italien à je ne sais trop quelle autre langue. Bref ça gâche tout. En plus le système d'objet qui disparaît de temps à autre ça aurait pu être sympa si seulement ils avaient pris la peine de faire une bonne traduction.
Quand tu es en train de chercher comme un con " un livre " et qu'au final faut trouver une règle qui disparait régulièrement. Franchement ça fout les boules et c'est comme ça tout le long du jeu.
Le jeu a été totalement baclé c'est flagrant.
Je ne le recommande surtout pas.
Même en promo je trouve qu'il ne vaut pas le coup.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125664030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 381, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1435397352}
